  • Experience with digital analytics tools like Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics.
  • Knowledge of agile development methodologies and version control systems such as Git.
  • Experience in the high-volume consumer electronics industry.

Must-Have Skills:

  • Programming Skills (Python): Proficiency in Python, including libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Matplotlib.
  • Data Engineering (SQL & Data Pipelines): Experience in SQL and building data pipelines/ETL processes using tools like Apache Airflow or AWS Glue.
  • Customer Experience Analytics: Understanding of customer experience principles, including analyzing and interpreting customer feedback and behavioral data.
  • Data Visualization: Experience working with metrics and building interactive dashboards using Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.

Nice-to-Have Skills:

  • Experience with digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics.
  • Knowledge of agile development methodologies and version control systems like Git.
  • Familiarity with Salesforce and customer support analytics.
  • Day-to-Day Responsibilities:
  • Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines for real-time insights.
  • Design and deploy self-service dashboards to empower stakeholders with actionable insights.
  • Establish data quality standards to ensure data integrity and reliability.
  • Define best practices for data visualization to facilitate informed decision-making.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance customer experience analytics.

Evaluation Metrics:

  • Ability to analyze and interpret complex data sets to inform business decisions.
  • Development and maintenance of robust data pipelines and analytics tools.
  • Collaboration with cross-functional teams to optimize customer experience.
  • Delivery of actionable insights and recommendations to leadership.
  • Application of data science and statistical expertise to enhance customer analytics.

Our benefits package includes:

Comprehensive medical benefits

Competitive pay

401(k) retirement plan

…and much more!

About INSPYR SolutionsTechnology is our focus, and quality is our commitment. As a national expert in delivering flexible technology and talent solutions, we align industry and technical expertise with our clients’ business objectives. Our tailored solutions include professional services, project support, and talent placement. By prioritizing excellence and the human aspect of our business, we connect top talent with the right opportunities. Learn more at inspyrsolutions.com.

INSPYR Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. We comply with applicable federal, state, and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.

The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data
Compile and analyze data related to business' issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion




Qualifications




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience
1 - 2 years' Data Analysis experience
Proficient in SQL

Title: Data Analyst: Data Products & Insights
Description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

Reporting to the Director, Data Products & Insights in the Chief Executive Auditor Group. This position is primary responsible for leveraging analytical and technical skills to enhance audit processes through data-driven insights. Responsibilities include analyzing large datasets for audit purposes, supporting audit findings with data, creating visualizations for reporting, and ensuring compliance with regulatory standards.

What will you do?


Data Analysis: Perform detailed analysis of large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies that could indicate risks or inefficiencies.
Audit Support: Utilize data to support audit findings, developing insights that inform audit strategies and risk assessments.
Data Visualization: Create dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate complex data insights effectively to stakeholders across various levels of the organization.
Tool Proficiency: Use and maintain analytical tools and software to enhance data collection, processing, and analysis capabilities.
Compliance and Regulation: Ensure data practices comply with both internal policies and external regulatory requirements like GDPR, SOX, etc.


What do you need to succeed?

Must have:


Strong quantitative and statistical analysis capabilities.
Ability to analyze large datasets for trends, anomalies, and risk indicators.
SQL proficiency for data querying, manipulation, and analysis.
Programming skills in at least one of the following: Python or R for advanced data analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).


Nice-to-have:


Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams including Data Governance, other analysts, and auditors.
Critical thinking to approach problems methodically and devise data-driven solutions.
Excellent communication skills to convey complex data insights to a non-technical audience.
Meticulous attention to detail ensuring high accuracy in analysis and reporting.


What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
A world-class training program in financial services
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work


Job Skills

Critical Thinking, Data Administration, Data Mining, Data Modeling, Data Movement, Detail-Oriented, Group Problem Solving, Oral Communications, Python (Programming Language), Quantitative Research, Research Documents, Structured Query Language (SQL), Written Communication

Additional Job Details

Address:

20 KING ST W:TORONTO

City:

TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

INTERNAL AUDIT

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

2025-03-19

Application Deadline:

2025-04-03

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Senior Data Analyst

Location: Scottsdale, AZ (On-site: Tuesday – Thursday)

Company: IntePros’ Premier Client

Company Overview

IntePros' premier client is a rapidly growing company specializing in real-time site intelligence and actionable reporting solutions for production builders and trades. Their innovative platform provides comprehensive visibility into site activities and powerful analytics to help businesses optimize operations, maximize resources, and enhance efficiency in the construction process.

Position Overview

The Senior Data Analyst will play a critical role in transforming complex business, customer, and technical data into actionable insights that drive decision-making for both internal stakeholders and external clients. This position requires a blend of technical expertise and business acumen to deliver advanced analytics and reporting across an integrated technology stack. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, business intelligence tools, predictive analytics, and data modeling.

Key Responsibilities


Data Analysis & Insights:
Conduct deep-dive analyses on complex datasets using advanced analytical techniques to derive meaningful insights.
Analyze customer data (both qualitative and quantitative) to uncover trends and provide actionable recommendations for improvement.
Perform ad-hoc and in-depth analyses to support business decision-making.
Reporting & Visualization:
Design, build, and deliver reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to empower clients to unlock the full potential of the platform.
Develop and maintain a repository of standardized and customized reporting templates to ensure efficiency and consistency.
Communicate complex data insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaboration & Stakeholder Management:
Partner with various departments (marketing, sales, product, operations) to understand business needs and align data projects with organizational goals.
Work with internal technical teams to address data gaps, improve data quality, and enhance reporting capabilities.
Machine Learning & Predictive Analytics:
Design, develop, optimize, and deploy machine learning algorithms, models, and applications.
Implement forecasting techniques to predict project timelines, focusing on reducing construction duration.
Utilize predictive analytics to support proactive decision-making and strategy development.
Technical Expertise:
Extract insights using data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Develop solutions utilizing data lakes and cloud platforms.
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis.
Key Requirements:


Experience:
Minimum of 4 years of experience in a data analytics role with a focus on solving complex business problems.
Proven track record in data analysis, statistical methods, and data visualization.
Experience with predictive analytics, machine learning, or forecasting methods is highly preferred.
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in an analytical field (e.g., Computer Science, Business Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics), or equivalent relevant experience.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and Excel (including macros, pivot tables, and advanced formulas).
Strong experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Knowledge of data lakes, cloud platforms, and Agile methodologies.
Soft Skills:
Strong business acumen with the ability to translate complex data into actionable business recommendations.
Excellent communication skills for presenting insights to stakeholders.
Self-starter with a proven ability to independently manage data analysis projects.
Preferred:
Experience in the home construction industry.
Work Environment:


This role requires on-site presence in Scottsdale, AZ three days a week (Tuesday – Thursday), with remote flexibility for the remainder of the week.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

We evolve our games and how players interact with them by using the power of data to continuously uncover insights to deliver an even better player experience. We strive to be the best-in-class AI team in the gaming industry by maximizing the fun for EA players through easier deployment of AI-driven solutions for game makers. Our insights are ubiquitous through autonomous analytics.

The Data and Analytics (DnA) team is looking for a Data Analyst to work either hybrid or remote from Vancouver, BC. The Data Analyst will focus on improving data capabilities and business intelligence for our Quality verification teams, astute at spotting patterns, identifying risk and opportunity and convey complex concepts, using game data to improve our Game Development and Quality Verification strategies.

You will report to the Analytics Manager.


You will define the data analytics roadmap for some of EA's largest titles.
You will use your technical skills to develop data products that improve decision-making across the Quality Verification organization.
You will guide best practices in tools and visual technologies to help evolve the project dashboards to provide essential data for project monitoring.
You will develop scripts and queries to import and manipulate data from multiple sources.
You will help us promote a data-driven culture and support data governance practices to improve our organization’s data maturity.


The Next Great Data Analyst Needs


2+ years of professional analytical experience, using data to improve processes.
Programming and Database experience with advanced SQL experience and efficient in Python.
Knowledge of different data software analytics and visualization tools such as Looker and PowerBI.
Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
Able to plan and prioritize multiple concurrent projects.
Able to foster working relationships with partners.


Compensation And Benefits

The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).

BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
$73,200 - $101,700 CAD

In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst 
Location: Redmond, WA
Duration: 12+ months
Work Requirements: US Citizen, GC Holders or Authorized to Work in the U.S.

Job Overview:
We are seeking a Data Analyst with expertise in RF testing and data analytics to drive insights from large datasets. This role requires hands-on experience with AWS tools for data mining, statistical analysis, and simulation modeling. The ideal candidate has 3-5 years of experience, a strong background in data science, and a solid understanding of RF testing principles.
Key Responsibilities:
Utilize AWS tools (familiar with running Lambda and SSM) to process and analyze large datasets related to RF testing.
Process RF test data from various sources, including spectrum analyzers, network analyzer, and antennas test chamber.
Automate data collection and analysis workflows using Python and JMP
Develop and apply statistical models to identify trends and improve test accuracy.
Work closely with RF engineers to interpret test results and refine data models.
Design and execute simulation models to enhance testing methodologies.
Generate reports and visualizations to support engineering and leadership teams.
Collaborate across teams to ensure data-driven improvements in testing processes.
Qualifications:
3-5 years of experience in data science, analytics, or related fields.
Proficiency in Python and JMP for data analysis and automation.
Hands-on experience with AWS tools for data processing and analytics.
Strong understanding of RF testing principles and data interpretation.
Ability to develop and apply statistical models for trend analysis.
Preferred Qualifications:
Background in wireless communications or signal processing.
Experience building custom simulation models for testing environments.

Our benefits package includes:
Comprehensive medical benefits
Competitive pay
401(k) retirement plan
…and much more!

About INSPYR Solutions
Technology is our focus and quality is our commitment. As a national expert in delivering flexible technology and talent solutions, we strategically align industry and technical expertise with our clients' business objectives and cultural needs. Our solutions are tailored to each client and include a wide variety of professional services, project, and talent solutions. By always striving for excellence and focusing on the human aspect of our business, we work seamlessly with our talent and clients to match the right solutions to the right opportunities. Learn more about us at inspyrsolutions.com.

INSPYR Solutions provides Equal Employment Opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, INSPYR Solutions complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities

  • Develop and apply statistical models to identify trends and improve test accuracy.
  • Work closely with RF engineers to interpret test results and refine data models.
  • Design and execute simulation models to enhance testing methodologies.
  • Generate reports and visualizations to support engineering and leadership teams.
  • Collaborate across teams to ensure data-driven improvements in testing processes.
Qualifications:
  • 3-5 years of experience in data science, analytics, or related fields.
  • Proficiency in Python and JMP for data analysis and automation.
  • Hands-on experience with AWS tools for data processing and analytics.
  • Strong understanding of RF testing principles and data interpretation.
  • Ability to develop and apply statistical models for trend analysis.
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Background in wireless communications or signal processing.
  • Experience building custom simulation models for testing environments.
Our benefits package includes:
  • Comprehensive medical benefits
  • Competitive pay
  • 401(k) retirement plan
  • …and much more!
About INSPYR Solutions
Technology is our focus and quality is our commitment. As a national expert in delivering flexible technology and talent solutions, we strategically align industry and technical expertise with our clients' business objectives and cultural needs. Our solutions are tailored to each client and include a wide variety of professional services, project, and talent solutions. By always striving for excellence and focusing on the human aspect of our business, we work seamlessly with our talent and clients to match the right solutions to the right opportunities. Learn more about us at inspyrsolutions.com.

INSPYR Solutions provides Equal Employment Opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, INSPYR Solutions complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
RPM is an international non-asset-based logistics and supply chain solutions company. Our focus is to provide customizable solutions tailored to support today’s complex supply chains. As one of the fastest-growing logistics companies in North America, RPM executes thousands of shipments per month through a combination of digital innovations and an unwavering commitment to customer success. RPM has evolved as a disruptive and differentiated, end-to-end transportation service provider, to meet the ever-changing needs of its customers. RPM proudly services the some of the most recognizable and transformative companies in the world as The Driving Force in Logistics™

Your Role

As a Data Analyst at RPM, you will take ownership of designing, developing, and maintaining interactive reports and dashboards to support decision-making across the business. You will work closely with stakeholders to define KPIs, ensure data integrity, automate reporting workflows, and enhance data accessibility. In this role, you will be an integral part of a collaborative team, working hand-in-hand with data engineers to ensure seamless data integration, tackle data quality challenges, and optimize reporting processes. This role requires a balance of technical expertise, analytical thinking, and business acumen to deliver actionable insights that drive business success.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities


Design, develop and optimize interactive reports, dashboards, and scorecards using Power BI
Design and refine KPIs and metrics to measure business performance
Write and optimize SQL queries to transform, explore, and analyze large datasets
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing validation processes
Implement and manage role-based security and user access for reporting
Collaborate with Data Engineers to enhance data models and improve reporting efficiency
Facilitate discussions with stakeholders to gather reporting requirements and translate business needs into technical solutions
Present insights and recommendations to non-technical audiences effectively


Preferred Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
3+ years of experience in data analytics or business intelligence
Strong proficiency in SQL for data manipulation and querying
Previous hands-on experience with Power BI, Tableau, Domo, or similar BI tools
Knowledge of data modeling, ETL/ELT processes, and data warehousing concepts
Familiarity with Power Query (M), DAX, and role-level security (RLS)
Ability to translate data insights into actionable business recommendations
Strong communication and presentation skills for sharing data insights
Skilled in documenting data processes, workflows, and reporting standards for clarity and consistency
Experience with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP, or similar)


Compensation And Benefits


Base + VC (based on achieving company goals)
BCBS (medical), Delta Dental & VSP (vision)
Life insurance, short & long-term disability – paid by RPM
Maternity & Paternity Leave
401(k) with generous employer match
Unlimited PTO – use it!


Come as You Are

RPM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. RPM does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need. This job description is intended to define the general nature of the work performed by employees assigned to this role. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills of employees in this role. All our employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time.

Recruitment Agency Notification: RPM does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Do not forward resumes to our careers email address, RPM employees, or any other company location. RPM is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

We evolve our games and how players interact with them by using the power of data to continuously uncover insights to deliver an even better player experience. We strive to be the best-in-class AI team in the gaming industry by maximizing the fun for EA players through easier deployment of AI-driven solutions for game makers. Our insights are ubiquitous through autonomous analytics.

The Data and Analytics (DnA) team is looking for a Data Analyst to work either hybrid or remote from Vancouver, BC. The Data Analyst will focus on improving data capabilities and business intelligence for our Quality verification teams, astute at spotting patterns, identifying risk and opportunity and convey complex concepts, using game data to improve our Game Development and Quality Verification strategies.

You will report to the Analytics Manager.


You will define the data analytics roadmap for some of EA's largest titles.
You will use your technical skills to develop data products that improve decision-making across the Quality Verification organization.
You will guide best practices in tools and visual technologies to help evolve the project dashboards to provide essential data for project monitoring.
You will develop scripts and queries to import and manipulate data from multiple sources.
You will help us promote a data-driven culture and support data governance practices to improve our organization's data maturity.


The Next Great Data Analyst Needs


2+ years of professional analytical experience, using data to improve processes.
Programming and Database experience with advanced SQL experience and efficient in Python.
Knowledge of different data software analytics and visualization tools such as Looker and PowerBI.
Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
Able to plan and prioritize multiple concurrent projects.
Able to foster working relationships with partners.


Compensation And Benefits

The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).

BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
$73,200 - $101,700 CAD

In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst, Global Partnerships & Content
Description:
The Global Partnerships & Content organization at Meta works closely with the leading content creators and media entities in the world to build and grow innovative and meaningful content and community engagement experiences across a variety of product areas. The Strategy & Operations team within the Global Partnerships & Content organization is seeking a Data Analyst to join the Strategy & Operations team. This role will be responsible for providing critical data analysis and business insights to inform organizational goals, drive strategic decision-making, and support business growth. You will leverage your expertise to develop dashboards, create data reporting solutions, and conduct in-depth analysis to drive business outcomes.

Data Analyst, Global Partnerships & Content Responsibilities:


Develop subject matter expertise in key partner ecosystem metrics across Meta’s Family of Apps.
Communicate complex data findings and recommendations in a way that is easily understandable by stakeholders with varying levels of technical expertise.
Build dashboards and reports to track key metrics over time, and guide future decisions.
Establish close working relationships with a variety of cross-functional stakeholders including strategy, data engineering, and business development teams.
Analyze and rigorously measure results and make data-driven recommendations for optimization of future programs and campaigns.


Minimum Qualifications:


5+ years experience in data analytics, including use of SQL, defining metrics, delivering regular insights reports, building dashboards, and making recommendations.
Presentation and communications experience with extracting insights from technical data sets to varied audiences.
Demonstrated experience thinking strategically about complex issues, leading to thoughtful recommendations and action plans.
Experience managing multiple projects simultaneously and working autonomously in a time-sensitive ambiguous environment.


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience building data pipelines.
Experience in media and/or music industry and understanding of associated metrics.


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$124,000/year to $176,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Assistant Data Analyst H/F
Description:
Rattaché(e) au département CRM, vous assisterez la responsable Data et l’accompagnerez dans l’ensemble de sa réflexion sur le pilotage et la compréhension du client Diptyque et plus particulièrement son comportement envers la marque et ses achats actuels ou futurs.




Description de poste :




Réalisation de reportings et de dashboards pour assurer le suivi régulier des KPIs clients et mise en lumière des enseignements associés
Réalisation d’analyses détaillées sur les opérations marketing ou dispositifs d’animations visant à mettre en évidence les succès ou les points d’amélioration.
Participation à la réalisation d’analyses approfondies sur le comportement client (omnicanalité, parcours de recrutement, performance produits…)
Monitoring des actions CRM afin de challenger le plan de contact et les ciblages associés
Participer à l’acculturation des différents interlocuteurs concernés tout en faisant preuve de pédagogie




Les missions ne sont pas exhaustives et peuvent évoluer en fonction des projets.




Profil recherché :




De formation supérieure type école d’ingénieur ou Master 2 avec une spécialisation en statistiques ou data, vous recherchez un stage de Data Analyst pour une durée de 6 mois à partir de juillet 2025.




Vous maitrisez impérativement SQL, et savez utiliser au moins un langage d’analyse de données tels que R ou Python. Une connaissance de Tableau serait un plus.

Vous avez un attrait pour le monde du Retail.




Vous vous reconnaissez dans le profil suivant :

· Bonne communication (en anglais et en français)

· Rigueur et organisation

· Esprit analytique et de synthèse

· Capacité à concevoir des présentations de vos analyses

· Vous connaissez les méthodes de machine learning

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world’s leading sexual wellbeing company, with the mission to elevate pleasure through innovative technologies, a data-driven approach, and foster creative and fresh perspectives on intimacy. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a streamlined online shopping experience.

At Lovehoney, we employ over 800 passionate and progressive individuals across 9 global offices, each person contributing a unique blend of talents to our diverse workforce. We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers’ lives.

Join us at Lovehoney, where pleasure combines with creativity, data, and innovation!

We are currently looking for a motivated and analytical Junior Data Analyst who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. In this role, you will be working within the central Data team to derive insights from the group data warehouse for teams across the business. You will be partnering with the finance, marketing and product teams to produce both reporting capabilities and insights through to production.

What You Will Do


Utilize SQL and Python for data analysis and problem solving.
Create and maintain data visualizations for effective storytelling.
Analyze core e-commerce KPIs to influence business strategies.
Ensure data stewardship to deliver accurate and reliable answers.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver insights.
Communicate and present complicated data analysis effectively to non-technical users.



What You Should Bring


Mathematical, scientific, or engineering degree and one year of relevant experience or two-plus years of relevant experience.
Proficiency in Big Query and SQL.
Experience in building visualizations and storytelling with data.
Understanding of Google Analytics 360.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience using Python specifically for creating Airflow dags is a plus.
Some experience with or knowledge of source control, GIT is a plus.
Understanding of data warehousing best practices is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complicated data analysis to non-technical users.



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, friendly faces and fun team-building events
Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers, in addition to a 50% discount on all Lovehoney products to explore and discover new ways to have fun
Enjoy a hybrid work model that fosters flexibility and work-life balance, with three days per week in-office and the opportunity to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, alongside 25 days’ holiday, plus an additional day for each year you are with Lovehoney, providing ample time for relaxation, rejuvenation, and exploration
Access to customised training opportunities to support your unique learning journey, complemented by biannual feedback cycles, offering valuable insights into your performance and growth areas, enhancing your development within the company.
Recognising the significance of physical and mental health, we proudly provide gym benefits in addition to a mental wellbeing platform, to ensure our employees thrive both professionally and personally.



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process, for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritise transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/
Show more

What You Will Do

  • Utilize SQL and Python for data analysis and problem solving.
  • Create and maintain data visualizations for effective storytelling.
  • Analyze core e-commerce KPIs to influence business strategies.
  • Ensure data stewardship to deliver accurate and reliable answers.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver insights.
  • Communicate and present complicated data analysis effectively to non-technical users.


What You Should Bring

  • Mathematical, scientific, or engineering degree and one year of relevant experience or two-plus years of relevant experience.
  • Proficiency in Big Query and SQL.
  • Experience in building visualizations and storytelling with data.
  • Understanding of Google Analytics 360.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Experience using Python specifically for creating Airflow dags is a plus.
  • Some experience with or knowledge of source control, GIT is a plus.
  • Understanding of data warehousing best practices is a plus.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complicated data analysis to non-technical users.


What We Can Offer You

  • A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, friendly faces and fun team-building events
  • Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers, in addition to a 50% discount on all Lovehoney products to explore and discover new ways to have fun
  • Enjoy a hybrid work model that fosters flexibility and work-life balance, with three days per week in-office and the opportunity to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, alongside 25 days’ holiday, plus an additional day for each year you are with Lovehoney, providing ample time for relaxation, rejuvenation, and exploration
  • Access to customised training opportunities to support your unique learning journey, complemented by biannual feedback cycles, offering valuable insights into your performance and growth areas, enhancing your development within the company.
  • Recognising the significance of physical and mental health, we proudly provide gym benefits in addition to a mental wellbeing platform, to ensure our employees thrive both professionally and personally.


Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process, for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritise transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
L’ambition de UNOWHY : créer l’Ecole du Futur !




Chez UNOWHY, l’expérience utilisateur est notre préoccupation principale.

Notre différence : créer des écosystèmes digitaux complets (suite logicielle, hardware, hébergement) centrés sur l’expérience utilisateur.




Afin de répondre à cette ambition, nous cherchons à compléter notre équipe avec un Data Scientist confirmé.




Missions

Le Data Analyst est responsable de la collecte, du traitement, de l’analyse et de la visualisation des données pour aider l’entreprise à prendre des décisions informées. Il/elle collabore avec différentes équipes pour comprendre leurs besoins en données et fournir des insights pertinents.

Responsabilités :

Collecte et préparation des données :

Collecter des données à partir de diverses sources internes et externes.
Nettoyer et préparer les données pour les analyses.
Assurer l’intégrité et la qualité des données.

Analyse des données :

Analyser les données pour identifier des tendances, des modèles et des insights.
Utiliser des outils statistiques et des techniques d’analyse avancées pour interpréter les données.
Développer des modèles prédictifs et des analyses exploratoires.

Visualisation et communication des résultats :

Créer des tableaux de bord et des rapports interactifs pour visualiser les données.
Présenter les résultats des analyses de manière claire et compréhensible pour les parties prenantes.
Communiquer les insights et recommandations aux équipes concernées.

Support aux équipes métier :

Collaborer avec les équipes marketing, finance, produit, etc., pour comprendre leurs besoins en données.
Fournir un support analytique aux projets stratégiques de l’entreprise.
Aider à la prise de décision basée sur les données.

Veille technologique :

Se tenir informé des dernières tendances et outils en matière d’analyse de données.
Proposer des améliorations continues pour optimiser les processus d’analyse de données.




Compétences requises :

Techniques :

Maîtrise des langages de programmation et outils d’analyse de données (SQL, Python, R, etc.).
Expérience avec les outils de visualisation de données (Superset, Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, etc.).
Connaissance des bases de données relationnelles et des techniques ETL (Extraction, Transformation, Chargement).

Statistiques et Analyse :

Solides compétences en statistiques et en analyse quantitative.
Capacité à interpréter des données complexes et à identifier des tendances significatives.
Expérience avec les techniques de modélisation prédictive et d’analyse exploratoire.

Communication :

Excellentes compétences en communication écrite et orale.
Capacité à vulgariser des concepts techniques pour des non-spécialistes.

Résolution de problèmes :

Forte capacité à résoudre des problèmes et à prendre des décisions basées sur les données.
Capacité à travailler de manière autonome et à gérer plusieurs projets simultanément.




Profil recherché

Vous êtes un développeur expérimenté (8 ans ou plus), la performance, la qualité et la maintenabilité du code sont vos préoccupations principales. Vous développez des tests unitaires permettant de valider le bon fonctionnement de vos productions et leur non-régression lors d’évolutions.

Vous intégrez les fonctionnalités développées dans les applications et la chaîne de production logicielle.

En collaboration avec les membres de l’équipe qualité, vous corrigez les défauts relevés ou rapportés dans les applications.

Vous réalisez la documentation technique de vos productions en Anglais et n’hésitez pas à rétro-documentez l’existant.

Vous participez à l’évolution des outils et des méthodes de l’usine de développement logiciel ainsi qu’aux différents processus d’amélioration continue. Vous partagez naturellement vos compétences, que vous faites par ailleurs progresser par de la veille technologique et de l’auto-formation.




Avantages Unowhy

Parcours d'intégration et un suivi de carrière individualisé
Possibilité d'évolution, mobilité interne et développement des compétences via la formation dans une entreprise en croissance
Prise en charge de 50% du titre de transport – tickets restaurant Swile
Prime de vacances et participation
Bureaux modernes et spacieux en plein Neuilly-sur-Seine (métro L1 Pont de Neuilly)
Ping-pong, terrasse en rooftop, salle de sport, des espaces détente avec canapés, télé pour « gamer », espace « silence », événements et afterwork

Title: Data Analyst | CDI | H/F
Description:
Vous êtes passionné/e par la data et prêt/e pour une nouvelle aventure dans une entreprise 100% data-driven ? Rejoignez Eulidia et embarquez dans une équipe de choc où l’excellence, le sens du service et la pluridisciplinarité sont les maitres mots!




🎯 Nous recrutons : Data Analyste

Vos missions, si vous les acceptez :

Collecter, analyser et interpréter des ensembles de données complexes comme si vous lisiez un livre captivant.
Créer et maintenir des rapports et des tableaux de bord qui rendent les données belles et compréhensibles.
Identifier les tendances et les modèles dans les données comme un Sherlock Holmes numérique.
Travailler avec différentes équipes pour comprendre leurs besoins en données et proposer des solutions qui font "Wahou !".
Assurer la qualité et l’intégrité des données avec une précision de maître.
Présenter les résultats d’analyse de manière claire, concise et surtout captivante aux parties prenantes.




Ce que nous vous offrons :

🏆 Un environnement de travail où le management est assuré par des tech passionné/es, pour des tech passionné/es.

🌍 Des projets data diversifiés et passionnants avec des partenaires de rêve (Tableau, Dataiku, Snowflake, Google, Azure...)

🚀 Des opportunités de croissance professionnelle, de formation continue, et de développer vos super-pouvoirs en data via notre organisme de formation interne

💡 Une culture d’entreprise où le teamswork Power est un mantra, et centrée sur l’innovation.

🏢 Un espace de travail hybride, alliant télétravail et présence au bureau pour plus de flexibilité et de confort.




Ce que Nous Cherchons :

Une personne diplômée d'un Bac+5 en statistiques, mathématiques, informatique, économie ou une spécialisation équivalente en magie des données.
Une expérience solide en tant que Data Analyst ou dans un rôle de « Data Master »
Maîtrise des outils d’analyse de données (SQL/ Python / Excel / Powerpoint) et de visualisation de données (Tableau, Power BI).
Un œil de lynx pour les détails et une curiosité insatiable.
Des compétences de communication et de présentation dignes de TED Talks




Pourquoi Nous ?

Chez Eulidia, nous croyons que c’est l’équipe qui fait la différence. Rejoindre notre crew, c'est faire partie d’une aventure humaine et technologique où chaque idée est une pépite et chaque contribution est célébrée !

Rejoignez l’aventure et faites partie de ceux qui transforment le monde avec la data!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Introduction

Are you a natural-born business analyst eager to delve deep into the challenges of the business? Are you passionate about data, its accuracy, and its proper interpretation, and how these contribute to informed management decisions? Do you have a talent for presenting business insights and information through clear visualizations? Then we are looking for you!




Job description

As a business analyst, you act as the bridge between the product owners and the technical BI team. Through workshops and individual discussions, you quickly familiarize yourself with the business domain, analyze business requirements, and ensure their accurate interpretation.
You create visualization proposals and align them with your stakeholders, leveraging your ability to present insights and information clearly.
You translate your findings and analyses into a detailed analysis document.
You engage with application owners and source data owners to design functional data flows. With sufficient technical knowledge, you can ask critical questions.
You support the BI and DWH architect in designing an optimal BI solution.
You describe, plan, and organize functional tests in a concrete test plan, and you actively participate in these tests.
You ensure the quality of datasets and the reporting portfolio, providing clear presentations of datasets and reports while informing the organization and the customer.




Requirements

You have 3-4 years of experience as an analyst conducting functional, process, or business analyses.
You have experience with data modeling techniques and/or other analytical methods.
You communicate fluently and quickly grasp business domains.
Experience in a BI environment or with reporting tools is a plus.
You excel at presenting data attractively using visualization techniques. You value not only accurate data content but also clear and visually engaging presentations.
You are critical and prioritize data accuracy and correct interpretation.
You can work independently and take ownership of your tasks.
You are structured, highly analytical, and capable of setting priorities. You strike the right balance between abstraction and detail.
You work result-oriented with an eye for risks and quality.
You communicate fluently in English.
You hold a master’s degree (e.g., Computer Science, Economics, Business Engineering, Business Information Management) or a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent through experience.




Offer

22 Annual Vacation days, 3 sick days that are not carried over the next year (no medical certificate required), plus a seniority day added every 3 years in the company
Meal tickets
Private Medical Insurance
We offer flexibility when it comes to WFH policy
Wellbeing at the center - we know that there is more to our lives than our jobs, therefore we make sure to tackle well-being aspects of our day-to-day lives through specialized sessions, webinars, and internal programs according to our employee's input
In close cooperation is a value we live by, through #MomentsThatMatter: monthly hangout parties, team buildings, gamified online experiences
Many more to come :)

Title: Data Analyst Europe (H/F)
Description:
Entreprise multinationale présente dans plus de 60 pays, nous proposons une gamme complète de services aux acteurs de la distribution automobile. Notre approche repose sur un accompagnement stratégique des réseaux de distribution.

Nous mettons à disposition des services à haute valeur ajoutée, combinant le consulting, des outils informatiques performants et une recherche constante d’optimisation pour renforcer la performance et l'efficacité de nos clients. Dans le cadre du développement d’un projet international d’animation et d’accompagnement des équipes commerciales et après-vente au sein des concessionnaires, nous recherchons un(e) Data Analyst Europe.




Mission :

En reporting direct auprès de notre Responsable Solutions Digitales et Innovation, votre mission consiste à accompagner les différents pays dans la production d’analyses de données liées à l’activité permettant aux différents acteurs (constructeur, réseau de distribution, zone Manager, Data Analyst des différents pays, etc.) de piloter et mesurer la performance des activités commerciales de produits additionnels (contrat service et extension de garantie).




Vos principales missions :

Recueillir les besoins d’analyse de données Europe et planifier le développement des reportings, redescendre les informations aux autres pays, transfert et gestion de données
Échanger régulièrement avec les différents interlocuteurs du projet
Accompagner les différents pays dans la production d’analyses et le suivi des Data Analyst
Apporter un soutien à l’équipe dans l’utilisation des outils et la construction d’analyses
Production de documents d’analyse et de synthèse (Volume de ventes, CA, facturation, suivi de plannings etc.) via Power BI
Collecter et compiler les informations quantitatives, chiffrées et qualitatives de l’équipe (réseau, constructeur, itinérants etc.)
Produire et diffuser des analyses des données (création et mise à jour de reportings, tableaux de bords, réalisation de statistiques, extractions etc.)
Suivre les indicateurs et réaliser des comptes rendus sous forme de documents de synthèse ou d’analyse
Accompagnement dans la démarche qualité, contrôle des données
Proposer des axes d'amélioration




Votre profil :

De formation supérieure en école de commerce ou spécialisation en gestion de projet digital, (traitement et analyse de données), vous justifiez d'une expérience significative d'au moins 5 ans (alternance comprise) sur un poste similaire où vous avez développé des compétences en gestion de projet.

En effet, une connaissance pertinente en tant que Data Analyst, en gestion de projet, en production de rapports BI et en automatisation de processus est indispensable. La capacité d'analyse et de synthèse est également essentielle, permettant de comprendre les besoins et problèmes, d'élaborer des solutions, de développer des plans d’action et de traduire les exigences, tout en automatisant les processus et en présentant des analyses claires.




Compétences techniques requises pour ce poste :

Maîtrise avancée de Power BI ainsi que des langages DAX et M utilisés dans cet outil
Power Automate
Power Query
Pack Office, en particulier Excel




Un niveau d'anglais courant est attendu, tant à l’écrit qu’à l’oral, avec la capacité de mener des discussions professionnelles et d’animer des réunions en anglais.




Enfin, nous recherchons une personne rigoureuse, respectueuse des processus, méthodes et délais, capable de tester et de vérifier ses productions de manière autonome. Une bonne organisation est cruciale, notamment pour la gestion du temps, des priorités et des délais.







Les bonnes raisons pour nous rejoindre :

L’opportunité de rejoindre une société responsable et internationale.
Rejoindre un groupe de référence disposant d’importants moyens.
L’opportunité d’être formé en continue grâce à un centre de formation interne.
Travailler dans une entreprise qui s’investit pour promouvoir la diversité et l’égalité.
La possibilité d’être autonome et responsable dans un climat de confiance mutuelle.
Vraie harmonie vie pro/vie perso avec une politique de télétravail avantageuse.

Show more

  • Produire et diffuser des analyses des données (création et mise à jour de reportings, tableaux de bords, réalisation de statistiques, extractions etc.)
  • Suivre les indicateurs et réaliser des comptes rendus sous forme de documents de synthèse ou d’analyse
  • Accompagnement dans la démarche qualité, contrôle des données
  • Proposer des axes d'amélioration


Votre profil :

De formation supérieure en école de commerce ou spécialisation en gestion de projet digital, (traitement et analyse de données), vous justifiez d'une expérience significative d'au moins 5 ans (alternance comprise) sur un poste similaire où vous avez développé des compétences en gestion de projet.

En effet, une connaissance pertinente en tant que Data Analyst, en gestion de projet, en production de rapports BI et en automatisation de processus est indispensable. La capacité d'analyse et de synthèse est également essentielle, permettant de comprendre les besoins et problèmes, d'élaborer des solutions, de développer des plans d’action et de traduire les exigences, tout en automatisant les processus et en présentant des analyses claires.


Compétences techniques requises pour ce poste :

  • Maîtrise avancée de Power BI ainsi que des langages DAX et M utilisés dans cet outil
  • Power Automate
  • Power Query
  • Pack Office, en particulier Excel


Un niveau d'anglais courant est attendu, tant à l’écrit qu’à l’oral, avec la capacité de mener des discussions professionnelles et d’animer des réunions en anglais.


Enfin, nous recherchons une personne rigoureuse, respectueuse des processus, méthodes et délais, capable de tester et de vérifier ses productions de manière autonome. Une bonne organisation est cruciale, notamment pour la gestion du temps, des priorités et des délais.



Les bonnes raisons pour nous rejoindre :

  • L’opportunité de rejoindre une société responsable et internationale.
  • Rejoindre un groupe de référence disposant d’importants moyens.
  • L’opportunité d’être formé en continue grâce à un centre de formation interne.
  • Travailler dans une entreprise qui s’investit pour promouvoir la diversité et l’égalité.
  • La possibilité d’être autonome et responsable dans un climat de confiance mutuelle.
  • Vraie harmonie vie pro/vie perso avec une politique de télétravail avantageuse.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role & responsibilities




Should be good at requirement gathering, documentation, presentation, and interaction with business stakeholders.
Should be capable to interact with developers and testers to build complex logic in EDW.
Technical knowledge of data models and database design.
Good knowledge of Teradata/SQL and writing little complex scripts proficiently
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Working with different stake holders to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data strategies.
Stakeholder engagement to develop existing artefacts in a clear interpretation of Data usage across each business and function
Should be capable of doing Business Acceptance Test/User acceptance test and System Integration test. Will be required to transform the business requirement into scripts.
Should be capable of doing AS-IS, TO-BE and Gap analysis.
Having worked in corporate banking/finance in Data space in the past will be helpful.




Experience & Skills:




Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst for at least 5 years.
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
Experience in handling reporting packages like Business Objects, programming (JavaScript, XML, or ETL frameworks), databases
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience of working in both Agile & waterfall SDLCs
Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate technical issues and strategy to both technical and non-technical audiences at senior levels within the bank. Interpersonal skills - collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation skills
Ability to work to strict deadlines and under pressure, deal with competing priorities
Excellent decision making & problem-solving skills. Ability to work on own initiative and being proactive.
Excellent organizational & prioritizing skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

We are partnering with a client seeking an experienced Data Analyst, reporting to the Data & Insights Manager. You will work closely with cross-functional teams—including marketing, product, and digital—to provide actionable insights through data analysis, visualizations, and performance tracking. This role offers the chance to play a key part in accelerating brand growth by translating complex data into meaningful business actions.




Key Responsibilities

Utilize SQL and/or Python to extract, clean, and analyse large datasets from multiple sources, including websites, social media, and digital campaigns.
Design, develop, and implement data visualizations to effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.
Monitor and analyse key performance metrics to identify trends and opportunities for optimization.
Support marketing teams by tracking campaign performance and suggesting data-driven improvements.
Develop and manage tracking strategies using tools like Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and Google Tag Manager.
Leverage Google BigQuery to process and analyze large datasets, enabling deeper insight into digital performance.




What You’ll Bring

Experience & Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field, or proven experience in data analysis.
3+ years of experience in a data analysis role with a focus on digital performance.
Proficiency in Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Google Tag Manager, and digital marketing platforms (e.g., Google Ads, Facebook Ads).
Strong SQL and/or Python skills with the ability to manipulate large datasets.
Experience working with Google BigQuery to analyze digital performance data.
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Studio.




Skills & Attributes:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a passion for leveraging data to improve business outcomes.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and compelling storytelling.
A data-driven mindset with a strong focus on improving customer experience and engagement.
Ability to work collaboratively across multiple teams and functions in a fast-paced environment.




Why Join?

This is a brilliant opportunity to make a real impact in a leading customer-centric organization. You’ll gain hands-on experience in digital analytics, collaborate with diverse teams, and play a crucial role in shaping data-driven strategies. If you’re passionate about using data to drive results and want to be part of an innovative and supportive environment, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Van Caem Klerks Group is seeking a Data Analyst/Analytics Engineer. You will be responsible for maintenance and further development of our Data Platform, reports and apps in Power BI, in-house built Python applications and user support.




Requirements

Fluent in English.
At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst/Analytics Engineer/Data Engineer.
Proficiency in SQL.
Data modelling knowledge.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work with people of different skill sets.
Knowledge of ETL/ELT.




Nice-to-haves

Experience with PowerBI.
Experience with dbt.
Experience with Azure.




Recruitment process

Get to know each other: you will have a 30-minute talk with our Analytics Engineer. This will lead to get to know each other and learning more about Van Caem Klerks Group and the Data Team's role within the company.
Technical assessment: during a longer assessment, around 1 hour, you will connect with our Analytics Engineer. You will discuss the technical side of the team's work. You also may be given a challenge, which can focus more on applying your skills than theoretical knowledge. For example, you may be asked to complete a SQL coding challenge.
Final call

Title: Data analyst junior (H/F/X)
Description:
Description De L'entreprise

Vous rejoindrez l'une des plus grandes marketplace immobilière au monde et une filiale d'Axel Springer. Notre mission est de permettre à chacun de trouver un logement idéal ! Vous travaillerez ainsi sur certaines des marques immobilières numériques les plus connues d'Europe, notamment : Meilleurs Agents, Groupe SeLoger, Immoweb, Immowelt, Housell, Yad2.

Description Du Poste

Rattaché à la Crédit Manager , elle-même rattachée à la directrice financière France, vos principales missions seront les suivantes:


Data crunching :
Gestion et mise à jour de fichiers Excel avec requêtes actualisables pour le service Recouvrement au quotidien
Import des données dans l’ERP
Extraction SQL diverses
Cross- check de la cohérence des datas en fonction des sources
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le Credit Manager et l’ équipe Cash Collection sur les besoins en matière d'analyse de données et de reporting.
Développer des tableaux de bord via Power BI- TABLEAU
Collecter, nettoyer et mettre en forme des KPI de performance ( cash collecté, litiges, Churn, Top 40, dossiers CTX ) et d’’activité du Recouvrement ( Flux entrants / sortants, dossiers à envoyer agences recouvrement ou avocats )
Préparation des fichiers mensuels W/O et deck investisseurs
Rédiger les modes opératoires nécessaires à la continuité d’activité.


Qualifications


profil Bac+4/+5 de type École de commerce/ Ecole d’ingénieurs/ Mastère Universitaire spécialisation Data, data analytics
Parfaite maîtrise d'Excel, et de l'ensemble du Pack Office.
Maîtrise de Power Bi (Office 365), VBA.
Python et SQL seraient un plus
Esprit d'analyse, organisation, rigueur, force de proposition, autonomie, travail en équipe et curiosité, seront les traits de caractère essentiels pour mener à bien vos missions.


Informations supplémentaires

Ce que vous allez adorer chez nous 🤩


Un fort esprit d'équipe
Une brillante équipe avec laquelle collaborer pour relever de beaux challenges
Une véritable volonté de vous accompagner dans votre carrière afin que vous puissiez grandir avec l’entreprise
Un environnement de travail stimulant qui encourage l’autonomie


Mais encore...

👩‍🏫 Formations (Parcours d’intégration, LinkedIn Learning, cours de langues en ligne)

🧘‍♀️Qualité de vie au travail (Télétravail, Moka Care)

💃 Evénements entreprise (Team building, soirées, Noël)

Le groupe AVIV est engagé pour l’égalité des chances. Tout le monde est le et la bienvenu·e. Nous encourageons la diversité dans nos équipes et travaillons à rendre notre environnement de travail inclusif pour tou·te·s. Aussi, quelle que soit votre origine, que vous soyez parents, LGBTQIA+, ou encore en situation de handicap, nous vous invitons à nous rejoindre ! Si vous avez besoin d’ajustements, dans la mesure du possible, à tout moment du processus, veuillez nous en faire part.

Dans votre candidature, n’hésitez pas à indiquer les pronoms que vous utilisez (ex: elle/il/iel, etc.).

A très vite !

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US

Established in 1973, EU Business School (EU) is an international, professionally accredited, high-ranking business school with campuses in Barcelona, Geneva, Munich and Digital. We offer foundation, bachelor’s, master’s, MBA, DBA and further education programs which focus on business administration. In 2022, EU Business School joined forces with OMNES Education Group.




ABOUT THE JOB

We’re looking for a Data analyst to join our dynamic, international team on our offices at the Barcelona campus. You’ll need to have a passion for data analysis, online marketing and enjoy working in multi-cultural fast-paced environment, demonstrating the ability to identify growth opportunities with excellent optimization skills. You’ll also have to be very well organized, with a results-oriented approach.




Responsibilities

As a Data analyst inside the EU Online Marketing Department, your responsibilities will include:

Design, build, and maintain the Online Marketing department's reporting, ensuring that data across all areas (web, digital acquisition, email marketing, etc.) is accurate and easy to interpret.
Continuously monitor data sources, including Zapier connections, forms, and file uploads, to ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Identify new data points needed to improve data traceability and reporting capabilities.
Analyse performance data to identify trends, areas for improvement, and opportunities for optimization across the funnel.
Communicate actionable insights and key findings to the entire marketing team, helping drive data-driven decision-making.




Qualifications and Skills

2+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a digital marketing or online marketing environment.
Strong proficiency in Power BI and HubSpot reporting tools.
Advanced knowledge of Excel and SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Experience working with marketing automation platforms and CRM tools (HubSpot and Microsoft Dynamics preferred).
Familiarity with Google Analytics, paid media platforms (Google Ads, Meta Ads, etc.), and email marketing metrics.
Ability to interpret complex datasets and present insights in a clear and actionable way.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail to ensure data accuracy.
Excellent communication skills to collaborate with marketing teams and translate data into strategic recommendations.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple reporting projects simultaneously.




ABOUT YOU

You have a scientific background with computational and analytical skills
At least two years of experience working on a similar position.
Critical thinker and adept problem solver.
Self-sufficient and proactive with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to multitask effectively.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Fluent in English, good presenter and communicator.
Open to feedback and able to adapt to new opportunities in an agile manner.
Team player.
You enjoy working in a fast-paced, international environment, demonstrating your ability to identify growth opportunities and improve our digital performance.




Please include your CV in English along demonstrating your experience or skills in your application.




At EU Business School, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment where everyone is valued and respected. Our hiring practices ensure equal opportunities for all candidates, and we actively promote a workplace that is accessible, supportive, and free from discrimination.

We believe that diverse perspectives drive innovation and success, and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds to join us in creating a more inclusive future.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Barden are delighted to be partnering with a multinational based in Cork to assist them in hiring an experienced Data Analyst. This in an urgent requirement and will initially be a 12 month contract.




It is a hybrid role and you would be required to be on site 2 - 3 days per week.




We are looking for a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst with around 3-4 years commercial experience. The ideal person would have a lot of experience utilizing advanced excel functions to manipulate and analyse large datasets.




You will have strong data mining, and data interpretation experience as the role involves analysing data, identifying trends, and developing actionable insights.




You will be comfortable using SQL and Tableau to create different reports from a broad range of data.




Perform data mining to extract relevant insights from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and reliability.




Prepare and present analytical reports to management, highlighting key trends and recommendations.




You will have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex information to non-technical stakeholders.




If you would like to hear more about this new opportunity please reach out to me today at dan.hoctor@barden.ie

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Talan is an international advisory group on innovation and transformation through technology, with 5000 employees, and a turnover of 600M€.

We offer our customers a continuum of services to support you at each key stage of your organization's transformation, with 4 main activities:



CONSULTING in management and innovation : supporting business, managerial, cultural, and technological transformations.
DATA & TECHNOLOGY to implement major transformation projects.
CLOUD & APPLICATION SERVICES to build or integrate software solutions.
SERVICE CENTERS of EXCELLENCE to support the latter through technology, innovation, agility, sustainability of skills and cost optimization.



Talan accelerates it's clients' transformation through innovation and technology. By understanding their challenges, with our support, innovation, technology and data, we enable them to be more efficient and resilient.



We believe that only a human oriented-practice of technology will make the new digital age an era of progress for all. Together let's commit!




Job Description


For our client's project, one of the largest banks in Spain, we are looking for a Data Analyst for Reconciliation to join our consultancy team. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in data analysis, backend processing, and reporting tools within an Agile environment.



What would you be doing?








Extract, process, and analyze large datasets to support reconciliation processes.




Develop and maintain data pipelines using Python and PySpark.




Create insightful reports and dashboards with QlikSense or Power BI.




Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment (Scrum/Kanban).




Ensure data accuracy and quality while optimizing processes.







Qualifications


What we are looking for?




Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a related field.




Experience: Minimum of 2 years as a Data Analyst in Delivery projects.




Technical Skills:




Strong proficiency in Python and PySpark for data processing.




Experience with QlikSense or Power BI for data visualization.




Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).






Language: Intermediate English (B2 level).







Additional Information


What do we offer you?



Full-time contract
Smart Office Pack so that you can work comfortably from home.
Training and career development
Benefits and perks such as private medical insurance, life insurance, lunch and travel cards as part of the flexible remuneration package
Possibility to be part of a multicultural team and work on international projects
Hibrid position based in Málaga, Spain. Realocation is mandatory
Possibility to manage work-permits.



If you are passionate about development & tech, we want to meet you!
