Title: Business & Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description




Would you like to work for a company where hospitality is a work of heart and you can be all you are?

Our purpose is to pioneer the art of responsible hospitality, connecting cultures with heartfelt care. With over 230,000 hospitality experts in more than 40+ hotel brands, we nurture a real passion for service and achievement beyond limits.

At the Accor Global Reservation Centre, we offer memorable experiences to our clients.

You will be part of an international team helping guests offering them the best experience when making the reservation in the luxury hotels around the world. You will be sharing your expertise and knowledge of our spectacular, world-class locations and properties while having authentic conversations with guests.




Job Description




Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst, where you'll turn complex data into actionable insights to drive business decisions and contribute to our organization's success




Job Purpose




As a Business and Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our center's business strategy, leveraging data insights to drive decision-making, optimize operations, and increase revenue. You will report directly to the hotel operations manager and oversee the WFM analyst activities.

In this role, you will focus on developing and enhancing Global Reservation Centre reporting and analyses, providing the foundation for informed business decisions. Your work will directly support operational improvements and revenue growth, making you a valuable contributor to our international and dynamic team.




Main Duties:




Consolidate reporting requirements from different regions, hotels, and centers, and prepare recurring performance reports for various stakeholders
Analyze complex data, identify anomalies, and provide actionable insights to support decision-making
Guide business line contacts in asking the right questions to drive data-driven decisions through effective storytelling
Build and enhance Global Reservation Centre reporting and dashboards to monitor daily, weekly, and monthly operational performance
Manage the master database, ensure data quality from multiple sources, and collaborate with the central data team in Paris to automate processes.
Develop and refine key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and improve performance
Identify areas for improvement and propose innovative solutions to optimize processes (e.g., automation, operational efficiency, productivity)
Transform raw data into meaningful statistical insights
Stay up to date with new tools and technologies relevant to data analysis and reporting
Act as a business partner for the Global Reservation Centre, providing ad-hoc analyses to support strategic decision-making
Promote a positive working environment and champion Accor’s Culture, Mission, Vision, and Values
Ensure compliance with relevant rules and procedures







Qualifications




Education and/or work experience in Business or Engineering school, specializing in Data, business analytics, and business strategy
Minimum 2 years work experience in a data-driven environment
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Deep knowledge of database languages (SQL); Excel (VBA will be a plus) and data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI), understanding the mechanism of CRM tools (Salesforce)
Familiarity with emerging technologies relevant to the industry positions analysts to adapt strategies to changing technological landscapes
Critical thinking, and solution-oriented, while being organized and structured
Agile and know how to adapt to different situations
Full business proficiency in English (written & verbal), a second/third language would be a plus
Hands-on and enjoy getting into the heart of the matter
Strong sense of responsibility and accountability
Respectful and collaborative within a diverse multicultural environment




What We Offer:




A dynamic and supportive work environment.
Opportunities for career growth in a global organization.
Collaboration with a talented, international team.




Additional Information




If you are passionate about luxury and sales, and are looking for a role that values genuine interactions and exceptional guest experiences, apply now to become a Luxury Reservation Consultant with us. Let's create unforgettable experiences together.




Location and Availability Requirements:




Must be currently legally entitled to work full-time in Spain
39 working hours/ week
Current opening hours: Mon-Sun 8am to 10pm




Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit, and promote diverse talent.

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS




What It’s Like to Work at Accor Global Reservation Centre:

LK : Accor GRC Barcelona

IG : GRC Barcelona

TikTok : grc.barcelona

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Growth Opportunity!
Description:
Junior Data Analyst – Growth Opportunity!




Impactful projects
Accelerate your career
Gain experience across multiple domains




Join a well-established Irish company that values its employees and invests in long-term career development. This is a unique opportunity for a Junior Data Analyst to refine their skills in a supportive environment while working across multiple domains!




As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in driving data-driven decision-making, leveraging AI-powered insights, and mastering industry-leading tools such as SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau, and Machine Learning.




You'll receive hands-on mentorship from seasoned professionals with over 20 years of experience, ensuring your growth in both technical expertise and business acumen.




You will:

Work with large datasets, using AI to improve efficiency and decision-making
Develop expertise in Power BI, Tableau, and SQL to create impactful visualizations
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize business strategies
Translate complex data into actionable insights for key stakeholders
Thrive in a dynamic environment with long-term career growth opportunities.




Skills/Experience:

1–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field
Proficiency in SQL, Python, Power BI, and Tableau
Strong communication and problem-solving skills.







Salary / Remuneration:

€25,000 - €35,000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
At BMW Group, we empower our customers to embark on an exciting journey with their BMW Group vehicles. Our dynamic Aftersales team continuously drives our business forward. So, if you are exploring real-life employment opportunities, you're sure to find an exciting challenge with us.




What awaits you?

In this role, you will be involved in:

Monitoring Parts Business - feedback to Management and Headquarters.
Monitoring all KPI’s and Dealers' performance via various reports.
Follow up on sales campaigns, special offers, discounts, special deals and other sales promotion programs - monitor the results and report to management.
Be responsible for providing all necessary reports in an accurate and efficient way.




What should you bring along?

Experience with Microsoft Office
High organizational skills
Fluency in English
Strong written and verbal communication skills




What do we offer you?

In addition to the motivating working environment in our dynamic teams, we offer:

Limited Contract
Continuous Training & Development opportunities.
A flexible working environment.
Well-being initiatives with various events.




Are you interested?

If the answer is yes, then do not miss the opportunity to apply and #shareyourpassion!✨




After the screening of all the CVs received, we will only contact the candidates who meet the requirements of the job to arrange an interview. All applications are considered strictly confidential.

Title: Data Analyst (Fashion Days Team)
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and we are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to make sure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues, as well as the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!


Fashion Days through eMAG IT is looking for a Data Analyst to join their Fashion Days Platform Team. We need a person with background in Data Analysis to help us leverage data to enhance our customer experience and satisfaction. As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with stakeholders across the organization to understand their data needs and provide them with relevant insights and recommendations to support business decisions and goals.


What you’ll have to do:

  • Gather, aggregate and analyze data from various sources, such as internal databases, Google Analytics and BigQuery to provide insights and support decision-making processes;
  • Work closely with your colleagues in improving the current tracking and develop new flows according to business needs;
  • Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify patterns and insights in customer journey (such as traffic sources, conversion rates, purchase frequency);
  • Perform regularly data checks to ensure data accuracy, integrity and accessibility for analysis purposes;
  • Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using data visualization tools to communicate insights effectively to stakeholders;
  • Work together with product and marketing teams to provide data-driven recommendations for improving user experience;
  • Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in e-commerce analytics, tracking and user behavior analysis.


How we’d like you to be:

  • University degree in Economics, Computer Science, or equivalent professional experience;
  • Have 2+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst or similar positions;
  • Have SQL experience;
  • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with complex datasets;
  • Able to translate business problems into quantitative analyses and produce useful insights;
  • Have excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate effectively with teams;
  • Detail-oriented and able to work independently;
  • Excellent English communication skills (spoken and written).


Nice to have:

  • Knowledge of Big Query and Google Analytics;
  • Familiarity with Python;
  • Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Looker Studio.


What we’ve prepared for you:

  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Atlas psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

The Data Strategy and Solution (DSS) team owns the research, creation, and maintenance of all 27,000+ distinct Label Insight attributes. This team is composed of industry experts including dietitians, food scientists, chemists, regulatory and product formulation experts. The Global Data Governance team within DSS is responsible for the quality and maintenance of our proprietary taxonomies: claims, certifications, ingredients, nutrients, and categories that are the foundation of all Label Insight data. The Data Analyst is detail-oriented, able to make fast, but thoughtful decisions around NIQ and Label Insight data, regulations, and trends in the FMCG and grocery industries. You will receive on-the-job training for creating and managing Label Insight data taxonomies which will enable various LI-powered solutions within NIQ. Your willingness to use new NIQ platforms, learn new skills like data review, analysis, and coding will help build and maintain our data quality and, ultimately, enable customer health, trust, and new growth opportunities

Job Description


Manage the processing of globally sourced, English language data that powers attribution for various solutions. This includes on-package marketing text, ingredients, and nutrient data
Interpret, analyze, and clearly communicate our data and taxonomy structure
Audit, improve and develop internal database taxonomies
Expand our database to align with growing market trends and global expansion projects
Learn simple coding language to build and maintain LI attribute-powered solutions
Work with customer success teams to investigate and resolve customer inquirie


Qualifications


University degree, bachelor's degree or equivalent
Native speaker or high proficiency in the English language - both orally and in writing. Comfortable understand different accents
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint)
Comfortable learning new technology platforms (Coding, BI tools, GitHub, etc.)
Detail-oriented with the desire and ability to pick up new skills quickly
Comfortable with tedious and repetitive tasks
Self-motivated and able to manage deadlines and time on projects independently
Experience in data quality management, data review, or data cleaning is preferred
Technical mastery of:
BI and data querying tools and languages including: Looker, Power BI, Solr, SQL, and ElasticSearch
Internal NIQ tools and databases including: Label Insight NPE, Label Insight Explore 4.0, BB Product Library, and NIQ Discover
Internal Label Insight data management portals including: Digi, Taxonomy Management & Creation Portals, AMP, and others


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Financial Services

Madrid, Spain - office based work.

Full-Time




About the Company:




My client are a leading financial services firm based in Madrid, dedicated to providing innovative financial solutions to a diverse range of clients. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. If you are passionate about working with data in the financial sector and want to be a key part of our growth, we want to hear from you!




Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis: Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets related to financial markets, investment portfolios, trading, and economic indicators.
Financial Insights: Provide actionable insights by analyzing market trends, financial products, and client data to support decision-making processes.
Reporting: Develop and maintain automated dashboards and reports to present key financial metrics and trends to stakeholders.
Modeling & Forecasting: Support the development of predictive models, risk assessments, and forecasting tools to enhance investment strategies.
Collaboration: Work closely with teams across trading, risk management, and finance to ensure data-driven decision-making and business alignment.
Compliance & Accuracy: Ensure data integrity and comply with industry regulations, ensuring accuracy in all reporting and analysis.




Qualifications:




Education: A Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Data Science from a top-tier university either globally or within Spain (e.g., Universidad de Barcelona, Universidad Autónoma de Madrid, IE University, or similar).

Experience:




A minimum of 2-3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst within the financial services industry (e.g., investment banks, asset management, trading, financial technology).
Solid understanding of financial data, including equity, bonds, derivatives, and market behavior.




Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and Python or R.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with financial data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to synthesize complex financial data into clear insights.
Fluent in English (both written and spoken); proficiency in Spanish is a plus.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for career advancement and professional development.
A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
The chance to work with cutting-edge financial technologies.

Show more
HTML:
Data Analyst – Financial Services

Madrid, Spain - office based work.

Full-Time


About the Company:


My client are a leading financial services firm based in Madrid, dedicated to providing innovative financial solutions to a diverse range of clients. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. If you are passionate about working with data in the financial sector and want to be a key part of our growth, we want to hear from you!


Key Responsibilities:

  • Data Analysis: Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets related to financial markets, investment portfolios, trading, and economic indicators.
  • Financial Insights: Provide actionable insights by analyzing market trends, financial products, and client data to support decision-making processes.
  • Reporting: Develop and maintain automated dashboards and reports to present key financial metrics and trends to stakeholders.
  • Modeling & Forecasting: Support the development of predictive models, risk assessments, and forecasting tools to enhance investment strategies.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with teams across trading, risk management, and finance to ensure data-driven decision-making and business alignment.
  • Compliance & Accuracy: Ensure data integrity and comply with industry regulations, ensuring accuracy in all reporting and analysis.


Qualifications:


  • Education: A Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Data Science from a top-tier university either globally or within Spain (e.g., Universidad de Barcelona, Universidad Autónoma de Madrid, IE University, or similar).

  • Experience:


    • A minimum of 2-3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst within the financial services industry (e.g., investment banks, asset management, trading, financial technology).
    • Solid understanding of financial data, including equity, bonds, derivatives, and market behavior.


    Skills:

    • Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and Python or R.
    • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
    • Familiarity with financial data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or similar platforms.
    • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to synthesize complex financial data into clear insights.
    • Fluent in English (both written and spoken); proficiency in Spanish is a plus.


    What We Offer:

    • Competitive salary and benefits package.
    • Opportunities for career advancement and professional development.
    • A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
    • The chance to work with cutting-edge financial technologies.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Accountable

Accountable is revolutionising financial management for the self-employed. Our platform simplifies taxes, accounting, and financial administration for the self-employed - and we're even expanding into banking. With a proven product and a growing customer base, we are now looking for a Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision making.




About the role

As a data analyst, you will play a critical role in optimising conversion to paid, ARPA, and monetisation strategies by running deep analyses, translating complex data into actionable recommendations and driving experimentation. Additionally, you will support our Performance Marketing team by identifying patterns, improving marketing efficiency, and helping optimise our key metrics.




Key Responsibilities




Revenue Growth & Experimentation (80%)
Analyse conversion funnels, pricing models, and customer behaviour to proactively identify revenue growth opportunities.
Identify friction points in the user journey and recommend data-backed optimisations.
Oversee tracking of key revenue metrics, including Conversion to paid, ARPA, cost of acquisition (CAC), lifetime value (LTV), Churn, and Retention in the company.
Build dashboards and visualisations to provide real-time insights to the company.
Take part in the Revenue Growth meeting, to come up with and implement data-driven growth experiments.
Support A/B testing and experimentation within the company, ensuring statistical analysis of results.




Performance Marketing Support (20%)
Identify patterns in user acquisition that can help optimise performance marketing campaigns.
Analyse and recommend levers to improve LTV & CAC.
Work with the Performance Marketing team to refine audience targeting and budget allocation.
Help the Content Marketing Team with data requests to enrich their content operations.




A quick word about data infrastructure

At Accountable, data is currently hosted in different services:

Our own database & its analytical datalake
Amplitude (user in-app events & visualization)
Intercom (CRM)
BigQuery (ETL engine)
Gsheet & Looker (visualization)




It will be expected of you that you can retrieve, combine & analyze data from those different sources to come up with the relevant insights.

We are constantly looking at ways to do things better and will likely, thanks to your help, improve this infrastructure




Who you are
Data-driven problem solver

Using programs such as Amplitude and Spreadsheets, you can turn raw data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.

Growth & experimentation mindset

You understand A/B testing, conversion optimisation, and monetisation strategies.

Business & product sense

You have great intuition when it comes to building product & having a meaningful impact for the company/our users.

Technical skills

Proficiently in basic programming (Python)

Proactive & collaborative

You take ownership, work independently, and thrive in cross-functional teams.

Bonus: marketing analytics experience

You understand digital marketing metrics, CAC/LTV, and how to optimise acquisition strategies.




Requirements
Based in Berlin
Fluent in German
A university degree in Data Analysis or a related field is preferred
Min. 3 years of experience in Data Analytics




Why join Accountable?

🌍 Work at a fast-growing fintech that’s making self-employment easier.

🥊 Make a direct impact on the growth and profitability of our business.

🎯 Join a data-driven culture that believes in rapid iteration, and making decisions based on data.

💡You will have the freedom to drive your own projects and influence key business decisions.

🤝 Work closely with Product, Marketing, and Engineering to bring data to life.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Overview

At HubSpot, we aim to help businesses grow better every day. We are looking for highly skilled Data Analysts to join our team!

Job Summary

We have a number of Analyst positions open at various levels of seniority across a range of focus areas, including; EMEA Sales Strategy & Operations, Global / EMEA Sales & Marketing Planning, Global Insights & Analytics and Global Partner / Channel Strategy & Operations.

In these roles you will be combining deep data insights with business expertise to deliver comprehensive solutions that tackle critical challenges and enhance both operational efficiency and strategic outcomes. Some of our analyst roles are more specialised. Our recruitment team will help match your experience to these roles and determine the best fit.

About The Team

Revenue Operations partners with GTM leadership to drive daily business and achieve long-term strategic priorities. We use a data-driven approach to solve complex issues and drive business planning from strategy to execution.

Key Responsibilities


Be the go-to expert for the business, playing a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making
Participate in and develop the analyst community, fostering a high-performing, insights-driven culture
Be hands-on, delivering critical insights that shape strategic decisions and ensure data is at the core of our operations
Partner with leadership to drive business strategy, planning, goal-setting, and performance tracking
Scope and lead high-impact projects and execute on mission-critical strategic initiatives


These roles offer significant exposure to HubSpot C-suite and growth opportunities. If you thrive in a high-impact, strategic role and want to shape the future of the business, we’d love to hear from you.

Qualifications


A minimum number of years experience in a sales strategy role or equivalent level position:
Analyst - Min. 2 Years
Senior Analyst - 4+ Years
Demonstrated expertise in analytical or modeling techniques using tools like Looker, Hex, or Google Suite.
Strong aptitude for defining key metrics and conducting analyses to derive actionable insights.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with a proven track record of presenting to revenue-driven executives.
Strong capability to identify personal and professional growth opportunities and willingness to expand beyond baseline responsibilities.
Proficiency with MS Office Suite, Google Apps, Salesforce.com, and HubSpot CRM.
Proven SQL knowledge and experience.
Python or R is a plus.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, autonomous working environment.


We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.

If you need accommodations or assistance due to a disability, please reach out to us using this form. This information will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of determining an appropriate accommodation for the interview process.

At HubSpot, we value both flexibility and connection. Whether you’re a Remote employee, or work from the Office, we want you to start your journey here by building strong connections with your team and peers. If you are joining our Engineering team, you will be required to attend a regional HubSpot office for in-person onboarding. If you join our broader Product team, you’ll also attend other in-person events such as your Product Group Summit and other gatherings to continue building on those connections.

If you require an accommodation due to travel limitations or other reasons, please inform your recruiter during the hiring process. We are committed to supporting candidates who may need alternative arrangements

Germany Applicants: (m/f/d) - link to HubSpot's Career Diversity page here.

India Applicants: link to HubSpot India's equal opportunity policy here.

About HubSpot

HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers’ needs at any stage of growth. We’re also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.

You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #2 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2022 and has been recognized for its award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.

Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees across the globe work remotely and in HubSpot offices. Visit our careers website to learn more about the culture and opportunities at HubSpot.

By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot’s use of your personal information.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Join a leading Retail Media venture at the forefront of innovation!




At Unlimitail, we are building the future of retail media in Europe and LATAM, combining Carrefour Links' immense in-store and e-commerce assets with Publicis’ advanced retail media technology. Our ambition? To become the number one retail media platform in Continental Europe and South America. Already partnered with 15+ major players since our Vivatech launch, we're set to welcome many more retailers into our growing ecosystem




Role Overview:




Within the Product team, your mission will be to participate in the development of Unlimitail’s analytics capabilities. Your environment will be millions of transactional data coming from major retailers on the market to analyze and improve the performance of online and offline marketing campaigns.

As we work with both retailers (providing media inventory) and brands (buying media inventory), you will have the opportunity to gain a deep understanding of the retail media ecosystem.




Your Mission:




You will work with different teams (Ad Operations, Marketing, Sales) in different countries on a wide variety of topics:




Perform ecommerce campaigns analysis to provide detailed insights
Conduct end to end ad hoc analysis to help retailers best monetize their inventory
Participate in the design and maintenance of databases, using SQL to store and manage data efficiently
Work on automating data analysis and data visualization capabilities
Work on Unlimitail’s customer lifetime value calculation capability
Participate in the development of new, cutting-edge capabilities to create the best retail media products




Qualifications:




Master's degree in Data Analysis, business analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or a related field.
First experience in data analysis
Data Analysis: Proven ability to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and extract actionable insights through using strong SQL skills for querying and data extraction.
Programming Languages: Python and SQL mandatory, any other is a plus
Data Visualization: previous experience in creating interactive and insightful visualizations, using tools like Power BI or Looker is a big plus
Knowledge of GCP or Azure environment is a plus
Problem-solving: Adept in approaching analytical problems and proposing effective solutions.
Good communications skills in English. Another language (Spanish, Portuguese) is a plus.
Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively




What We Offer:




🗺️ Work in a fast-paced, international, and innovative environment

👨‍💻 A flexible remote work policy of 2 days/week

🥐 Office located in the heart of Paris (Châtelet district)

🚆 You'll receive a 90% reimbursement of public transportation

🍕 Enjoy a 10€/day Swile card for each working day, we'll cover 60% of the cost




Ready to make a big impact? Apply now and be part of our innovative journey!




Unlimitail is committed to fostering a diverse workforce and strongly encourages applications from underrepresented groups. We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of their background.




If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with the recruiter who contacts you.

Title: Master Data Analyst
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!


Master Data Analyst


What you’ll have to do:


  • You will act as an expert user who can approve, validate, or reject data maintenance requests;
  • You will maintain/check/modify the master data for suppliers/clients;
  • Ensure compliance with processes/procedures for master data;
  • Provide a single point of contact for stakeholders and offer best practices;
  • Manage, improve, and provide visibility into the company's data performance.


What makes you a good fit:


  • Are passionate about Finance and you want to work in a dynamic environment;
  • Knowledge of the English language - intermediate level;
  • Excel knowledge - intermediate level;
  • Knowledge of the SAP platform is an advantage;
  • Knowledge of the master data module is an advantage;
  • Verbal and written communication skills;
  • Time management skills;
  • Analytical ability to solve problems and apply expert knowledge on master data processes and structures to find the most efficient solution;
  • Ability to understand an end-to-end process;
  • Strong attention to detail.


What we’ve prepared for you:


  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Skill Development!




Work on impactful, AI-driven projects
Enhance your technical expertise in a supportive environment
Gain exposure across multiple business domains




Applicants must have a Stamp 4 visa or an EU Passport




Join a well-established Irish company known for its stability and commitment to long-term employee development. This is a unique opportunity for a Data Analyst to refine their skills in a collaborative setting while working across multiple domains. The company has a strong track record of retaining its employees, offering a secure and supportive work environment.




As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making, utilizing cutting-edge AI-powered insights and industry-leading tools such as SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Python. You will work closely with an experienced Senior Data Analyst with over 20 years of industry expertise, ensuring continuous learning, mentorship, and professional growth.




If you are eager to expand your expertise, contribute to impactful projects, and be part of a company that values long-term career progression, this is the perfect opportunity for you.




You will:

Utilize AI-driven analytics to enhance business efficiency and outcomes.
Strengthen your expertise in SQL and visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize business strategies.
Translate complex datasets into actionable insights for key stakeholders.
Thrive in a dynamic, growth-oriented environment with strong career prospects.




Skills/Experience:

2–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
Strong proficiency in SQL, with hands-on experience in Power BI and Tableau.
Excellent communication skills, to present insights effectively to stakeholders.




Salary / Remuneration:

€35.000 - €40.000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

About Archer – Archer Recruitment is a Specialist IT Recruitment

Title: Data Analyst Intern (H/F/N)
Description:
Company Description

Believe is one of the world’s leading digital music companies. Believe’s mission is to develop local artists and labels in the digital ecosystem by providing them the solutions they need to grow their audience at each stage of their career and development.

Its 2,020 employees in more than 50 countries aim to support local artists and labels with a unique digital expertise, respect, fairness and transparency.

To support our fast-growing presence on all continents, we are constantly looking for new Believers to join us and make a stronger and more positive impact on the music industry!

Believe is listed on compartment A of the regulated market of Euronext Paris (Ticker: BLV, ISIN: FR0014003FE9).

Ready to #setthetone with Believe?

Job Description

ROLE’S EXPECTATIONS

As a Data Analyst Intern in the Product Team, you will contribute to the success and growth of many artists and labels. Your insights will directly shape the strategies that help artists grow their fanbase and reach new heights in their careers. You'll dive into cutting-edge projects, from developing advanced data models to uncovering viral trends that shape the music industry by analyzing impact of Believe’s partners, including Spotify, YouTube, TikTok, and others...

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include

Creation and improvement of Power BI Dashboards:


design and develop dashboards to track the performance and accuracy of Tiktok viral trends detection data models,
follow the adoption of Believe products by artist, producers and internal teams,


Conducting Ad Hoc Analyses to support artists making the best decisions to develop their audience at every stage of their career, Turn your insights into actionable data models that will be integrated into our products, helping artists make informed decisions every day.

Qualifications


Demonstrated interest for the music industry,
studying in last year of a master’s degree from an Engineering or Business school with a specialization in data. Looking for an end-of-studies internship,
previous internship or student experience working with data or analytic topics,
proficient with SQL and visualization tools, Python a plus. Anyway, you are curious and fast learner, you love watching online tutorial until you become expert in a new coding language,
fluent in English, spoken and written. Comfortable working day to day in English.


Additional Information

Our interview process is designed to be as transparent and supportive as possible, giving you a chance to showcase your skills and learn more about our team. The process will consist of one HR fit interview, one case study to test analytic skills and two interviews with the team.

Ready to make your mark on the future of music? Apply now and start your journey with Believe!

Set the tone with us

Working at Believe means having individual and collective impact in a fast-growing company!

At all stages of their careers, Believers are an important part of what we are doing: shaping the future of the music industry.

We need teams that truly reflect the diversity of our clients: our international presence is an inspiring and enriching work environment for each one of us, with daily opportunities to connect with our colleagues all over the world.

We have two hearts at Believe - our People and our Artists.

We believe in THE POWER OF OUR PEOPLE, who grow every day to develop their potential… We aim to provide our Believers with the best environment to thrive.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Believe is one of the world’s leading digital music companies. Believe’s mission is to develop local artists and labels in the digital ecosystem by providing them the solutions they need to grow their audience at each stage of their career and development.

Its 2,020 employees in more than 50 countries aim to support local artists and labels with a unique digital expertise, respect, fairness and transparency.

To support our fast-growing presence on all continents, we are constantly looking for new Believers to join us and make a stronger and more positive impact on the music industry!

Believe is listed on compartment A of the regulated market of Euronext Paris (Ticker: BLV, ISIN: FR0014003FE9).

Ready to #setthetone with Believe?

Job Description

ROLE’S EXPECTATIONS

As a Data Analyst Intern in the Product Team, you will contribute to the success and growth of many artists and labels. Your insights will directly shape the strategies that help artists grow their fanbase and reach new heights in their careers. You'll dive into cutting-edge projects, from developing advanced data models to uncovering viral trends that shape the music industry by analyzing impact of Believe’s partners, including Spotify, YouTube, TikTok, and others...

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include

Creation and improvement of Power BI Dashboards:

  • design and develop dashboards to track the performance and accuracy of Tiktok viral trends detection data models,
  • follow the adoption of Believe products by artist, producers and internal teams,

Conducting Ad Hoc Analyses to support artists making the best decisions to develop their audience at every stage of their career, Turn your insights into actionable data models that will be integrated into our products, helping artists make informed decisions every day.

Qualifications

  • Demonstrated interest for the music industry,
  • studying in last year of a master’s degree from an Engineering or Business school with a specialization in data. Looking for an end-of-studies internship,
  • previous internship or student experience working with data or analytic topics,
  • proficient with SQL and visualization tools, Python a plus. Anyway, you are curious and fast learner, you love watching online tutorial until you become expert in a new coding language,
  • fluent in English, spoken and written. Comfortable working day to day in English.

Additional Information

Our interview process is designed to be as transparent and supportive as possible, giving you a chance to showcase your skills and learn more about our team. The process will consist of one HR fit interview, one case study to test analytic skills and two interviews with the team.

Ready to make your mark on the future of music? Apply now and start your journey with Believe!

Set the tone with us

Working at Believe means having individual and collective impact in a fast-growing company!

At all stages of their careers, Believers are an important part of what we are doing: shaping the future of the music industry.

We need teams that truly reflect the diversity of our clients: our international presence is an inspiring and enriching work environment for each one of us, with daily opportunities to connect with our colleagues all over the world.

We have two hearts at Believe - our People and our Artists.

We believe in THE POWER OF OUR PEOPLE, who grow every day to develop their potential… We aim to provide our Believers with the best environment to thrive.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WHO ARE WE?




We are PressEnter! A team of talented specialists trailblazing new pathways in iGaming.




Being bold and innovative are what drive the business to new levels, in such a competitive industry we understand this rollercoaster can be fast paced and a bit hectic. PressEnter will support you on this journey just as you support us!




Being a people first organization isn’t something we just say, we operate on a foundation of transparency, camaraderie and mentorship all whilst focusing on your wellbeing. You are a valued member of our team and we can’t wait to have you on board and part of a culture that embraces diversity and inclusion and an environment that promotes career progression and opportunities.




WHAT WILL YOU DO?




We are looking for a Data Analyst who will be responsible for creating, maintaining, and supporting the whole business with insights, tools, and reports within our fast-growing organisation.




In this role, you will be focused on utilizing our BI tools and databases to provide valuable insights on our business performance and business needs to the business.




The role will entail building and maintaining dashboards, reports, and tools to support our business. This opportunity will allow a successful candidate to help shape our business practices and provide key inputs to our commercial team and allow them to make effective business decision.




A successful candidate will be motivated to improve our commercial business and have a mindset of driving improvements and accelerating others around themselves.




Oversee month-end closing of accounts and identify issues
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards and data structures within our BI system
Liaise with key stakeholder in the business for appropriate business support
Determine and verify internal systems and process operational data
Deep dive into data and identify and investigate trends
Administer all business units, analyse financial risks and recommend effective solutions
Reviewing business performance and reporting findings to stakeholders
Assist with the budget and forecast process
Assist with the preparation and evaluation of business cases
Analyse business processes and develop cost saving controls
Develop business processes, evaluations, analytical reports, and tools in order to achieve more efficient and effective work processes
Ad-hoc reporting for Management




WHO ARE YOU?




A minimum of 3 years experience in analytics or data science related field within iGaming.
Experience with forecasting and prediction models, player segmentation, and quantitative analysis.
Understanding of Tableau or similar BI tool.
Understanding of SQL databases and data structures.
Programming experience is a big plus (any language)
Industry experience
Strong ability to analyse needs of the business and communicate these needs to stakeholders and development teams.
Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
Ability to multi-task and manage multiple assignments in a fast-paced environment.
Strong written and oral communication skills in addition to a skill for presenting sorting, segmenting, and communicating figures visually. Fluency in written and spoken English.
Initiative to work independently, but also able to work effectively with team members in different locations.
Flexibility and adaptability to business requirements and priority changes.
Excellent organizational skills




WHAT WE OFFER?




HQ in Sliema, Malta with fantastic sea views, shower facilities and open plan working space
Hybrid Model
Mental Well-Being Program
Friday social gatherings at the terrace
Team and Company events
Refer a Friend Bonus!
Combination of Private Health Insurance, Dental Insurance and vouchers
Discounted gym membership




If you want to be part of an exciting business and you feel that the above describes you, we would love to hear from you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Develop Your CRM Expertise!




Exciting career growth opportunities
Flexible and collaborative work environment
Enhance your technical skills in CRM and data analytics




This is a unique opportunity to join a highly regarded Irish organization known for excellence and innovation. As a CRM Data Analyst, you will be essential in delivering accurate reporting and valuable insights to drive strategic business decisions.




As a CRM Data Analyst, you will extract and analyse data from Aptify, uncover trends, and enhance automation processes. You will also provide data-driven support, working with Power BI, Excel, and CRM systems to optimize reporting and business insights.




If you are a junior data analyst eager to expand your expertise in CRM systems while working in a supportive and dynamic environment, this is the perfect opportunity for you!




You will:

Manage and enhance reports and automation systems using Power BI.
Extract and analyse data to provide actionable insights – Aptify CRM.
Identify trends in customer and member behaviours.
Support team members with data-related queries and reporting needs.
Maintain and improve automation processes for efficiency.




Skills/Experience:

Proficiency in Power BI, Excel (Advanced), and VBA.
Experience working with CRM databases.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.




Salary / Remuneration:

€40,000 - €46,000

Paid sick leave, 20-day AL, pension plan, discount on gym, 5% bonus!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

About Archer – Archer Recruitment is a Specialist IT Recruitment

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
📢 Oportunidade: Senior Data Analytics

📍 Localização: Lisboa

🌍 Regime Laboral: Híbrido (3 dias x presencial, 2 dias remoto)

📄 Tipo de Contrato: Full-time


Um cliente está a criar uma nova área de Data Analytics com impacto direto no suporte às diferentes áreas de negócio internas – e estamos à procura de um(a) profissional com forte background técnico e experiência sólida em liderança para assumir este desafio estratégico.


💼 O Desafio:

Estamos à procura de alguém que não só domine o mundo dos dados, mas que também tenha a capacidade de liderar equipas e projetos, definir standards e boas práticas, e ser uma referência técnica dentro da organização.

Esta função será essencial na estruturação da nova área, garantindo a entrega de soluções analíticas de valor, alinhadas com os objetivos do cliente.


🔍 Perfil que procuramos:

  • Formação superior em Engenharia Informática, Sistemas de Informação ou áreas similares (preferencial);
  • 5 a 9 anos de experiência profissional em Data Analytics ou áreas relacionadas;
  • Experiência comprovada em liderança técnica e/ou coordenação de equipas;
  • Capacidade de traduzir requisitos de negócio em soluções técnicas e estratégicas;
  • Fluência em inglês (escrito e falado).


🛠️ Competências Técnicas valorizadas:

  • Experiência em manipulação e análise de grandes volumes de dados;
  • Domínio de bases de dados relacionais e conhecimento de standards de metadados;
  • Experiência com ferramentas como SQL, Power BI, Excel Avançado, Python ou R (ou outras ferramentas de análise);
  • Familiaridade com ETL, modelação de dados e boas práticas de governance;
  • Conhecimento de metodologias ágeis e de gestão de projetos será um plus.


Se tens paixão por Análise de Dados e gosta de liderar esta oportunidade é para ti! 🚀

🔗 Candidata-te agora e vem fazer parte deste desafio!

Title: Data analyst
Description:
El desafío n.º 1 de toda empresa que busca desarrollarse es el reclutamiento de nuevos talentos.

"Crear una cultura de empresa basada en la agilidad y valorar la experiencia de nuestros empleados" es lo que te ofrecemos al unirte a la aventura #eXalt.




Actualmente en pleno crecimiento y con 5 años de existencia, nuestra empresa desea implementar una organización aún más cualitativa de lo que ya somos.




¡Hemos inaugurado nuestra oficina de España!




Ya hemos logrado una pequeña parte de lo que imaginamos... pero seguimos creciendo ¡y por eso queremos contar contigo!




¿Por qué unirse a eXalt?




La fortaleza de eXalt es organizarse internamente como una organización de productos y cultivar. Nos comprometemos a apoyarte a lo largo de tu carrera gracias a nuestra capacitación y nuestro apoyo en la aprobación de certificaciones. Impulsados ​por nuestros valores de co-creación, doocracia y beta permanente, te permitiremos prosperar en un entorno dinámico y promover tu proactividad y espíritu de iniciativa.




¡Buscamos perfiles de Data Analyst para nuestros equipos de Data e IA!




¿Qué funciones tendrás?




Vas a colaborar con personal interno y externo de la compañía para llevar a cabo la gestión tecnológica de proyectos encaminados al ámbito de Data, coordinando con la responsable del centro de competencias y con el negocio. Se trata de proyectos dentro del área de IA generativa y Data, de nueva creación.




Perfil buscado:




🎓Posees un título universitario (o equivalente).

🔍Cuentas con experiencia como Data Analyst durante al menos 2 años.

🤝Tu capacidad para colaborar y comunicarte de manera efectiva es excepcional, tienes autonomía e iniciativa.

📊Experiencia con SQL, entorno GCP y herramientas de visualización como PowerBI y Looker Studio.

📸Valorable experiencia con Qlik sense.

📒Inglés intermedio fluido hablado (B2 alto).




Ubicación:

La sede está en Charmartin, Madrid. Modalidad híbrida de 2 días presenciales a la semana.




Proceso:

️ ☎️ Primer contacto telefónico con Carla Navarro, IT Talent Acquisition Specialist | 5-10 min.
👤 Entrevista con Carla Navarro, IT Talent Acquisition Specialist | 45 min.
👥 Entrevista con Marta Sebastián, Digital Sales Manager | 30 min.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Yext (NYSE: YEXT) is the leading digital presence platform for multi-location brands, with thousands of customers worldwide. With one central platform, brands can seamlessly deliver consistent, accurate, and engaging experiences and meaningfully connect with customers anywhere in the digital world. Our AI and machine learning technology powers the knowledge behind every customer engagement, which is only possible through our team of innovators and enthusiastic collaborators. Join us and experience firsthand why we are consistently recognized as a ‘Best Place to Work’ globally by industry leaders such as Built In, Fortune, and Great Place To Work®!

We’re excited to share that Yext has recently joined forces with Hearsay Systems, forming a unified organization that is stronger than ever. This strategic acquisition enhances our ability to deliver world-class solutions by combining industry-leading digital presence management with compliant engagement solutions across social media, text, and voice. As we begin this exciting new chapter together, we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to help us integrate and continue to innovate in our shared mission.

This role will be part of the Hearsay team, now an integral part of Yext.

This is a hybrid position, offering the flexibility of remote telework with the requirement to be on-site at least one day per week on average. Occasional adjustments may be made based on team needs or project demands.

This is a maternity cover position, estimated to last up to 18 months.

As a Data Analyst on the Value Consulting team, you’re passionate about translating a large volume of numbers into actionable business recommendations. Your work will help Yext customers and colleagues make more informed decisions; customers will better understand how to optimize their social media and compliant texting programs, and our company will continue learning how to better serve them in these efforts.

We’re looking for someone who has exceptional analytical skills, a passion for making customers successful, and a drive to get things done. Experience generating data insights that drive executive level stories and presentations is the core of this role, and your work will impact several teams, including your Value Consulting teammates, Customer Success Managers, Platform Reporting partners and Yext customers.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with CSMs to understand client needs, pull relevant data and generate visuals for key customer presentations
Work with various large reports to determine key actionable insights around data and user activity
Help drive data-backed “stories” – data analysis will drive key customer and company- level conclusions around areas of improvement, best practices, and program effectiveness
Determine industry-specific customer trends on social media effectiveness and end-user best practices
Work with internal Customer Success and Support data to find key improvement metrics on process and product
Help provide feedback to Hearsay Systems’ Product team on customer and company data needs
Collaborate with internal Value Consultants on data projects to help drive our customers’ ROI with Hearsay


What You Have


3+ years experience in a data-centric, analytical role
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to deliver multiple work streams on time with a high attention to detail
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Superb Excel skills: data analysis, structured and unstructured data, charting and graphs
Excellent MS Powerpoint/Google Slides skills
Advanced knowledge of Looker or other data visualization tools
SQL skills a strong plus – pulling data from database directly to obtain necessary data
Strong attention to detail, ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects


Yext is committed to building an inclusive and diverse culture where every person is seen, heard, and valued. We believe in equal employment opportunity and welcome employees and applicants of all races, colors, ethnicities, religions, creeds, national origins, ancestries, genetics, sexes, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientations, genders (including gender identity or nonbinary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), ages, physical or mental disabilities, citizenships, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. It is Yext’s policy to provide reasonable accommodations to people with disabilities as required by law. If you have a disability that requires an accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, or participating in the employee selection process, please complete this form.

Title: Data Analyst - PowerBI
Description:
🤔Who are we?





As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 10 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto and Casablanca. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise




.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Manpower Croatia for Globalna hrana (McDonald's), a global leader in the quick-service restaurant industry, serving millions of customers every day, is looking for an ideal candidate to fill in the position of Data Analyst (m/f).




Place of work: Zagreb




Job description:




Customer & Market Insights:

Analyze customer data, organize and interpret market research to understand consumer behavior and preferences.
Identify trends in customer behavior, loyalty, and engagement to inform business strategies.
Conduct competitor analysis to benchmark McDonald's performance against industry trends.

Business Performance Analysis:

Assess restaurant and market performance by analyzing sales, traffic patterns, and operational metrics.
Support decision-making with data-driven recommendations for pricing, promotions, brand activations and menu development.
Develop and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure business success.

Data & Reporting:

Build reports and dashboards to track customer insights and business performance.
Work with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI) to present findings in a clear and actionable manner.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure insights are integrated into marketing and operational strategies.

Strategic Recommendations:

Provide recommendations to improve customer experience based on data insights.
Support digital and loyalty program initiatives with customer segmentation and personalization strategies.
Identify new opportunities for growth by leveraging data from various sources.




Requirements:




Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Data Analytics, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in similar working position.
Strong analytical skills with experience in Excel, and data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Ability to translate data into meaningful business insights and strategic recommendations.
Experience working with large datasets and market research methodologies.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Galway Hybrid

Duration: 12 Month Contract

Job Description: A Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics team is seeking a software engineer with experience in SQL, Tableau, Power BI, and BI Publisher. As a Software Engineer, your role is to create dashboards and reports to support business partners, as well as migrate reports from legacy platforms to new platforms as efficiently as possible.

Required Experience & Qualifications:

5+ years of industry experience as a software application engineer and developer
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, or equivalent technical field
Ability to work independently and build communication and rapport with partners and stakeholders
Expertise in writing SQL using Analytical and Aggregate functions in ANSI standards
Experience working with Oracle 12c and above
Knowledge of VBA macros and ability to decode and rewrite into SQL
Experience with BI tools such as Oracle Analytics Publisher, BI Publisher, Crystal Reports, or Power BI Report Builder for creating paginated reports
Experience with analytical BI tools like Tableau or Power BI
Knowledge of Autosys or any scheduling tool is preferred
Working experience with BI Publisher using Excel and Word templates is a significant advantage
Knowledge of Snowflake is a plus
Experience with performance tuning is a plus
Experience working in an Agile environment
Ability to take initiative, define a vision for product improvement, and execute with high quality
Ability to anticipate roadblocks, diagnose problems, and generate effective solutions

Skills & Abilities:

Strong data visualization skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to explain complex or technical information in a simple way to non-technical audiences
Strong prioritization skills within a dynamic and shifting environment
Ability to deliver solutions independently while working within a team of engineers
Strong client engagement skills with the ability to develop relationships and understand user needs
Effective collaboration with diverse individuals and groups in a constructive manner
Passion for automation, process improvement, and problem-solving
Creativity in determining optimal solutions for real-world problems
Willingness to challenge assumptions and explore alternative approaches
Enthusiasm for learning and delivering in a fast-paced environment

Key Responsibilities:

Understanding business users’ objectives and determining how best to deliver exceptional solutions
Recommending the right software tools and implementation strategies based on problem statements
Translating business requirements into technical requirements
Developing high-quality applications, user interfaces, and automation processes for business and technical users
Creating new applications, taking over ongoing projects, and supporting completed projects with maintenance and enhancements
Sharing knowledge and skills with peers to enhance the team’s overall impact

Impact of the Role: This role provides technology and support for portfolio management, research, trading, and investment operations. The team plays an integral role in delivering innovative, scalable, and industry-leading investment tools that enhance business capabilities globally.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for a Data Analyst!




Responsabilities:

You support to migrate current developed reports from Tableau On-premises to Tableau Cloud.
You collaborate with your data science team to smoothly switch reporting used data source from Microsoft SQL Server to Microsoft Azure.
You rebuild current developed reports with modern look and feel.
You reconfigure current developed reports if any business logics are changed while migration.
You develop new reports to support customers’ needs.
You work in a cross functional agile environment with an international team.
You stay updated on the latest advancements in data science, business intelligence, etc.




Requirements:

You have a Bachelor or Master degree in the field of Statistics, Business informatics, Econometrics or any related discipline.
You are fully skilled with Tableau, ideally certificated with “Tableau Certified Data Analyst” or higher.
You are experienced in Tableau environment and familiar with the DAX functions.
You bring work experience in any relevant field, ideally 5 years at least in similar analytical context with relevant quests for ITSM. (e.g. Incident Management, Problem Management, etc.) or CMDB (Configuration Management Database)
You are experienced in working in agile team and you can proactively explore and communicate findings.
You bring a strong expertise in cloud as well as on-premises storage systems. (preferably MS SQL Server and Azure services)
You have an analytical mindset with strong knowledge, and you are capable of communicating findings through the cross functional team.
You are fluent in English.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV in to vanessa.romao@decskill.com with reference “VR/DataAnalyst”.




Thank You!




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Global Data Governance Analyst
Description:
Company Description

The Data Strategy and Solution (DSS) team owns the research, creation, and maintenance of all 27,000+ distinct Label Insight attributes. This team is composed of industry experts including dietitians, food scientists, chemists, regulatory and product formulation experts. The Global Data Governance team within DSS is responsible for the quality and maintenance of our proprietary taxonomies: claims, certifications, ingredients, nutrients, and categories that are the foundation of all Label Insight data. The Global Data Governance Analyst is detail-oriented, able to make fast, but thoughtful decisions around NIQ and Label Insight data, regulations, and trends in the FMCG and grocery industries. You will receive on-the-job training for creating and managing Label Insight data taxonomies which will enable various LI-powered solutions within NIQ. Your willingness to use new NIQ platforms, learn new skills like data review, analysis, and coding will help build and maintain our data quality and, ultimately, enable customer health, trust, and new growth opportunities

Job Description


Manage the processing of globally sourced, English language data that powers attribution for various solutions. This includes on-package marketing text, ingredients, and nutrient data
Interpret, analyze, and clearly communicate our data and taxonomy structure
Audit, improve and develop internal database taxonomies
Expand our database to align with growing market trends and global expansion projects
Learn simple coding language to build and maintain LI attribute-powered solutions
Work with customer success teams to investigate and resolve customer inquirie


Qualifications


University degree, bachelor's degree or equivalent
Native speaker or high proficiency in the English language - both orally and in writing. Comfortable understand different accents
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint)
Comfortable learning new technology platforms (Coding, BI tools, GitHub, etc.)
Detail-oriented with the desire and ability to pick up new skills quickly
Comfortable with tedious and repetitive tasks
Self-motivated and able to manage deadlines and time on projects independently
Experience in data quality management, data review, or data cleaning is preferred
Technical mastery of:
BI and data querying tools and languages including: Looker, Power BI, Solr, SQL, and ElasticSearch
Internal NIQ tools and databases including: Label Insight NPE, Label Insight Explore 4.0, BB Product Library, and NIQ Discover
Internal Label Insight data management portals including: Digi, Taxonomy Management & Creation Portals, AMP, and others


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst con Power BI
Description:
¡Ampliamos nuestro equipo! 🔎




¿Buscas un nuevo reto donde desarrollar tu carrera y aprender nuevas tecnologías? Entonces sigue leyendo porque esto te puede interesar.




Scalian es una empresa de más de 6.000 personas con una dimensión internacional, con oficinas en Europa y América del Norte. Estamos especializados en dar servicios a diferentes clientes enfocados en Data, Cloud e Inteligencia Artificial.




¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con Power BI para integrarse en nuestro equipo de profesionales de Scalian. Dentro de este rol estarás desarrollando las siguientes funciones:

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards interactivos en Power BI que proporcionen insights clave para diferentes áreas de la empresa.
Crear y mantener medidas y cálculos complejos utilizando DAX para proporcionar análisis avanzados y personalizados.
Colaborar estrechamente con el Data Engineering Lead y su equipo para garantizar que los modelos de datos sean óptimos para el reporting.
Aplicar las mejores prácticas de diseño de visualizaciones para asegurar claridad, accesibilidad y usabilidad.
Asegurar que los informes y dashboards estén actualizados y reflejen los datos más recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.




Requisitos mínimos:

Sólidos conocimientos puestos en práctica con Power BI.
Experiencia y conocimiento de DAX.
Fluidez escrita y hablada en inglés.
Valorable tener certificaciones de Power BI.




¿Qué tendrás con nosotros?

🚀 Formar parte de un equipo de alto nivel bajo tecnologías punteras en el mercado.

💻 Modalidad 100% teletrabajo

⛱ 25 días laborables de vacaciones

📝 Contrato indefinido

📚 Formación continua, certificaciones, meetups y planes de desarrollo profesional personalizados para que podamos seguir creciendo juntos. Contamos con acceso a plataformas internas con contenido abierto para que lo disfrutes cuando tú quieras y a tu ritmo.

🕐 Jornada completa con horario flexible para facilitar la conciliación entre vida familiar y profesional.

🎉 After works en las oficinas

🎂 La tarde del cumpleaños libre

🏋️‍♀️ Descuentos en gimnasios

💲Programas de retribución flexible: seguro médico, tarjeta restaurante, abono de transporte, cheques para escuelas infantiles.

🌏 Como parte del grupo Scalian, abrimos nuestras fronteras y crecemos internacionalmente.

♻️ En el grupo apostamos por iniciativas sostenibles.




¡Despega en tu carrera con Scalian Spain!✈
