  • Asegurar que los informes y dashboards estén actualizados y reflejen los datos más recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.


Requisitos mínimos:

  • Sólidos conocimientos puestos en práctica con Power BI.
  • Experiencia y conocimiento de DAX.
  • Fluidez escrita y hablada en inglés.
  • Valorable tener certificaciones de Power BI.


¿Qué tendrás con nosotros?

🚀 Formar parte de un equipo de alto nivel bajo tecnologías punteras en el mercado.

💻 Modalidad 100% teletrabajo

⛱ 25 días laborables de vacaciones

📝 Contrato indefinido

📚 Formación continua, certificaciones, meetups y planes de desarrollo profesional personalizados para que podamos seguir creciendo juntos. Contamos con acceso a plataformas internas con contenido abierto para que lo disfrutes cuando tú quieras y a tu ritmo.

🕐 Jornada completa con horario flexible para facilitar la conciliación entre vida familiar y profesional.

🎉 After works en las oficinas

🎂 La tarde del cumpleaños libre

🏋️‍♀️ Descuentos en gimnasios

💲Programas de retribución flexible: seguro médico, tarjeta restaurante, abono de transporte, cheques para escuelas infantiles.

🌏 Como parte del grupo Scalian, abrimos nuestras fronteras y crecemos internacionalmente.

♻️ En el grupo apostamos por iniciativas sostenibles.


¡Despega en tu carrera con Scalian Spain!✈

Title: Data Analyst HR Junior
Description:
Max Mara Fashion Group
An Italian House of Brands, Family Owned Since 1951.



Passion, commitment and tradition have created a unique fashion style: today 10 Main Brands and more than 60 different Collections find common ground in quality, style and respect for the distinctive feature that make Max Mara Fashion Group one of the most famous worldwide.



Max Mara Fashion Group, with more than 40 companies and over 5,500 employees, operates in 105 countries.
Our ecosystem is made of more than 50 Departments, including Fashion Design, Marketing, Operations, Retail, Stores, ICT, Architecture Design, Economics, BI, etc. in an Holistic approach to our Customers and leveraging all the new digital competences.





Job Description



The HRIS analyst collects, organizes, analyzes, and interprets data contained within the company’s HRIS (HCM Systems, HR Databases and more). He/She studies the data, and creates reports summarizing important findings. He/She works closely with other teams and stakeholders to identify data points that would be significant, and then perform data analysis to gather that information.
The HRIS analyst should be comfortable using programming languages, proficient with data analytics, and should have experience using tools for data visualization like Tableau,Power BI, etc. Familiarity with HR software programs is helpful. Strong organizational skills are required.
Reports to the HR Digital Manager/Coordinator





Qualifications







Manages the Information Design tools connected to Data Visualization (dynamic and interactive representation through BI dashboards)
Develops new knowledge from the analysis of the data it uses to inspire decisions and drive business
Create and manage standard dashboards and other information delivery services for internal customers.
Maintain and develop enterprise-wide metrics for strategic reporting and analysis.
Presents data and analyzes effectively to internal stakeholders
Uses statistical techniques to produce solutions to emerging problems
Develop customized reports to meet user needs.
Capitalizes on the use of insights, findings, datasets and statistical models for various business needs
Keeps updated on new tools and techniques of data analysis
Perform regular HRIS data audits to ensure system accuracy.
Team with IT to manage system feeds to vendors and other related systems.
Promotes the development of training/learning of the Role through self, digital and collaborative learning activities aimed at innovation and improving the effectiveness and efficiency of one's Responsibilities
Promotes, adopts and develops the use of technologies digital within its function in relation to both the management of the process and in relations with internal and external interlocutors involved in the business
Adopts significant behaviors and promotes actions linked to Sustainable Development, understood as the interconnection of practices oriented towards Environmental Care of Business Processes and Organizational Community
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SEARGIN IS HIRING!

As a dynamic multinational tech company operating in 50 countries, we drive innovation and create projects that shape the future and greatly enhance the quality of life. You will find our solutions in the space industry, supporting scientists in the development of cancer drugs, and implementing innovative technological solutions for industrial clients worldwide. These are just some of the areas in which we operate!




Currently, for the new Seargin project, we are looking for a Data Analyst.




Cooperation: B2B

Location: Remote work from Poland




The Domain Delivery Transformation program aims to unify and optimize this ecosystem of three product lines for a more streamlined and cohesive structure. The program will enable simplified and consistent end-to-end delivery and support processes in order to increase future agility and achieve cost efficiencies and a consistent employee experience.

This is achieved by consolidating a significant range of current fragmented managed services contracts, harmonizing and simplifying underpinning support processes and by leveraging a clear sourcing strategy for all contributing roles to the product enabling services within the SS&WE domain.




Role Overview:

Support data-driven decision-making by providing accurate forecasts and strategic recommendations for process improvement and automation.
Drive self-service reporting initiative using ThoughtSpot




Responsibilities for the position:

Generate data insights using trends and storytelling techniques to support decision-making
Identify areas for improvement by analyzing large volumes of data
Predictive analytics for budget forecasting and onsite support issues




Required technologies and skills:

Python
Tableau
ThoughtSpot
Snowflake
SQL
ML
Great storyteller




Other Needs for Resource Consideration:

Proactive and self-driven
Critical thinking




Discover the Power of IT Excellence. Apply!

To learn more about Seargin, please visit our web page: www.seargin.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

The Data Strategy and Solution (DSS) team owns the research, creation, and maintenance of all 27,000+ distinct Label Insight attributes. This team is composed of industry experts including dietitians, food scientists, chemists, regulatory and product formulation experts. The Global Data Governance team within DSS is responsible for the quality and maintenance of our proprietary taxonomies: claims, certifications, ingredients, nutrients, and categories that are the foundation of all Label Insight data. The Data Analyst is detail-oriented, able to make fast, but thoughtful decisions around NIQ and Label Insight data, regulations, and trends in the FMCG and grocery industries. You will receive on-the-job training for creating and managing Label Insight data taxonomies which will enable various LI-powered solutions within NIQ. Your willingness to use new NIQ platforms, learn new skills like data review, analysis, and coding will help build and maintain our data quality and, ultimately, enable customer health, trust, and new growth opportunities

Job Description


Manage the processing of globally sourced, English language data that powers attribution for various solutions. This includes on-package marketing text, ingredients, and nutrient data
Interpret, analyze, and clearly communicate our data and taxonomy structure
Audit, improve and develop internal database taxonomies
Expand our database to align with growing market trends and global expansion projects
Learn simple coding language to build and maintain LI attribute-powered solutions
Work with customer success teams to investigate and resolve customer inquirie


Qualifications


University degree, bachelor's degree or equivalent
Native speaker or high proficiency in the English language - both orally and in writing. Comfortable understand different accents
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint)
Comfortable learning new technology platforms (Coding, BI tools, GitHub, etc.)
Detail-oriented with the desire and ability to pick up new skills quickly
Comfortable with tedious and repetitive tasks
Self-motivated and able to manage deadlines and time on projects independently
Experience in data quality management, data review, or data cleaning is preferred
Technical mastery of:
BI and data querying tools and languages including: Looker, Power BI, Solr, SQL, and ElasticSearch
Internal NIQ tools and databases including: Label Insight NPE, Label Insight Explore 4.0, BB Product Library, and NIQ Discover
Internal Label Insight data management portals including: Digi, Taxonomy Management & Creation Portals, AMP, and others


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Financial Services

Madrid, Spain - office based work.

Full-Time




About the Company:




My client are a leading financial services firm based in Madrid, dedicated to providing innovative financial solutions to a diverse range of clients. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. If you are passionate about working with data in the financial sector and want to be a key part of our growth, we want to hear from you!




Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis: Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets related to financial markets, investment portfolios, trading, and economic indicators.
Financial Insights: Provide actionable insights by analyzing market trends, financial products, and client data to support decision-making processes.
Reporting: Develop and maintain automated dashboards and reports to present key financial metrics and trends to stakeholders.
Modeling & Forecasting: Support the development of predictive models, risk assessments, and forecasting tools to enhance investment strategies.
Collaboration: Work closely with teams across trading, risk management, and finance to ensure data-driven decision-making and business alignment.
Compliance & Accuracy: Ensure data integrity and comply with industry regulations, ensuring accuracy in all reporting and analysis.




Qualifications:




Education: A Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Data Science from a top-tier university either globally or within Spain (e.g., Universidad de Barcelona, Universidad Autónoma de Madrid, IE University, or similar).

Experience:




A minimum of 2-3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst within the financial services industry (e.g., investment banks, asset management, trading, financial technology).
Solid understanding of financial data, including equity, bonds, derivatives, and market behavior.




Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and Python or R.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with financial data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to synthesize complex financial data into clear insights.
Fluent in English (both written and spoken); proficiency in Spanish is a plus.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for career advancement and professional development.
A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
The chance to work with cutting-edge financial technologies.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
About the Role:

We are looking for a data wizard to join our Data Analytics team as part of our Data & Advanced Analytics department.

As a data analyst you will interact with data warehouse developers, data engineers and other key stakeholders to maintain the data ecosystem up to date and we are counting on your curiosity and technical knowledge to extract actionable insights from terabytes of data.



Responsibilities:

  • Key role in creating and maintaining dashboards using Power BI that display key performance indicators which are used across the company;
  • Work closely with analysts from other departments on defining and implementing solutions for new reporting needs, offer support regarding data inquiries;
  • Leverage analytical applications to translate data into stories and explain the meaningful conclusions of the analysis in written verbal and visual form;
  • Answer to ad-hoc data requests.


Requirements:

  • 3+ years of relevant analytical experience in a Data Analyst/Reporting Analyst/Business Intelligence Developer position;
  • Previous experience using SQL to manipulate large volumes of data;
  • Previous experience working with data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau or Qlik);
  • Ability to be flexible and work analytically in a problem-solving environment;
  • Ability to present data analysis results using storytelling capabilities;
  • Ability to work independently while prioritizing multiple projects and tasks.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Accountable

Accountable is revolutionising financial management for the self-employed. Our platform simplifies taxes, accounting, and financial administration for the self-employed - and we're even expanding into banking. With a proven product and a growing customer base, we are now looking for a Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision making.




About the role

As a data analyst, you will play a critical role in optimising conversion to paid, ARPA, and monetisation strategies by running deep analyses, translating complex data into actionable recommendations and driving experimentation. Additionally, you will support our Performance Marketing team by identifying patterns, improving marketing efficiency, and helping optimise our key metrics.




Key Responsibilities




Revenue Growth & Experimentation (80%)
Analyse conversion funnels, pricing models, and customer behaviour to proactively identify revenue growth opportunities.
Identify friction points in the user journey and recommend data-backed optimisations.
Oversee tracking of key revenue metrics, including Conversion to paid, ARPA, cost of acquisition (CAC), lifetime value (LTV), Churn, and Retention in the company.
Build dashboards and visualisations to provide real-time insights to the company.
Take part in the Revenue Growth meeting, to come up with and implement data-driven growth experiments.
Support A/B testing and experimentation within the company, ensuring statistical analysis of results.




Performance Marketing Support (20%)
Identify patterns in user acquisition that can help optimise performance marketing campaigns.
Analyse and recommend levers to improve LTV & CAC.
Work with the Performance Marketing team to refine audience targeting and budget allocation.
Help the Content Marketing Team with data requests to enrich their content operations.




A quick word about data infrastructure

At Accountable, data is currently hosted in different services:

Our own database & its analytical datalake
Amplitude (user in-app events & visualization)
Intercom (CRM)
BigQuery (ETL engine)
Gsheet & Looker (visualization)




It will be expected of you that you can retrieve, combine & analyze data from those different sources to come up with the relevant insights.

We are constantly looking at ways to do things better and will likely, thanks to your help, improve this infrastructure




Who you are
Data-driven problem solver

Using programs such as Amplitude and Spreadsheets, you can turn raw data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.

Growth & experimentation mindset

You understand A/B testing, conversion optimisation, and monetisation strategies.

Business & product sense

You have great intuition when it comes to building product & having a meaningful impact for the company/our users.

Technical skills

Proficiently in basic programming (Python)

Proactive & collaborative

You take ownership, work independently, and thrive in cross-functional teams.

Bonus: marketing analytics experience

You understand digital marketing metrics, CAC/LTV, and how to optimise acquisition strategies.




Requirements
Based in Berlin
Fluent in German
A university degree in Data Analysis or a related field is preferred
Min. 3 years of experience in Data Analytics




Why join Accountable?

🌍 Work at a fast-growing fintech that’s making self-employment easier.

🥊 Make a direct impact on the growth and profitability of our business.

🎯 Join a data-driven culture that believes in rapid iteration, and making decisions based on data.

💡You will have the freedom to drive your own projects and influence key business decisions.

🤝 Work closely with Product, Marketing, and Engineering to bring data to life.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your future is Fujitsu

At Fujitsu, our focus on human-centric innovation is impacting the way the world transforms to a digital future. We see it on a global and local scale and we know that the power of innovation and human connection can create a more trusting, sustainable and responsible world for all. We are looking to grow our team with committed people to work in a challenging, but extremely rewarding environment using the latest technology to offer ground breaking solutions to everyday problems for our customers. This is your world and your opportunity to shape it for the better.




Note that this vacancy is Remote, but our candidates must be based in Portugal.




We are looking for highly motivated and results orientated data analysts. Possessing proven expertise in Qlik Sense and potentially some Power BI knowledge. To leverage their skills to transform existing Power BI dashboards to Qlik Sense, ensuring the key purpose and insights required from the existing dashboards are available from the new Qlik Sense dashboards. They will work directly with senior members of the team and the Technical Team leader.

Specific Requirements

Certified or very experienced Qlik Sense user with demonstrable skills
An awareness of Power BI and AWS is beneficial
Exceptional ability to work with the business to understand the business process and reporting purpose
Excellent ability to translate existing data & dashboards requirements into effective new solutions
Optimal and efficient use of Qlik Sense to create visualizations; building sheets, create KPIs, build complex formulas, dynamic charts etc
Creates accurate, easy to digest/interpret solutions, adhering to internal guidelines
Collaborates effectively with the team to fill knowledge gaps and request support
Uses their initiative to problem solve
Proactively conducts test and validation of dashboard functionality & insights, ensuring data accuracy and integrity of the solution
Manages the UAT process by engaging with business users
Provides input and support to the wider team into best practice for report development
Engages with the wider team daily, scrum calls and meetings
Highly organised and well versed with agile development methodology
Exceptional analytical and time management skills
Exceptional communication skills




At Fujitsu, you will enjoy:

Competitive salary
Employment with the possibility of a permanent contract
Life insurance and private health insurance extensive to children for free and since first day of employment
Work life balance with part-time/full-time schedules available and 25 annual leave days
International career in a dynamic and enthusiastic environment
Training and internal career progression plan upon hiring
Several discounts available with our partners
Training and international career progression plan upon hiring
Dynamic and enthusiastic work environment with colleagues from more than 60 countries
The chance to get involved in our Social Responsibility program and participate in several initiatives with focus on wellbeing, diversity and inclusion, environment and our community (medical services, Yoga lessons, fresh fruit, volunteering afternoons)
Great Facilities at Central locations well served by public transportation, bicycle access and services
If you are moving to Portugal, we also offer the support of our Welcome Buddy to help you settle in.
Remote Working Available
An IKEA voucher to help you build your own home office
…and much more!

HTML:
Your future is Fujitsu

At Fujitsu, our focus on human-centric innovation is impacting the way the world transforms to a digital future. We see it on a global and local scale and we know that the power of innovation and human connection can create a more trusting, sustainable and responsible world for all. We are looking to grow our team with committed people to work in a challenging, but extremely rewarding environment using the latest technology to offer ground breaking solutions to everyday problems for our customers. This is your world and your opportunity to shape it for the better.


Note that this vacancy is Remote, but our candidates must be based in Portugal.


We are looking for highly motivated and results orientated data analysts. Possessing proven expertise in Qlik Sense and potentially some Power BI knowledge. To leverage their skills to transform existing Power BI dashboards to Qlik Sense, ensuring the key purpose and insights required from the existing dashboards are available from the new Qlik Sense dashboards. They will work directly with senior members of the team and the Technical Team leader.

Specific Requirements

  • Certified or very experienced Qlik Sense user with demonstrable skills
  • An awareness of Power BI and AWS is beneficial

  • Engages with the wider team daily, scrum calls and meetings
  • Highly organised and well versed with agile development methodology

  • Exceptional communication skills


At Fujitsu, you will enjoy:

  • Employment with the possibility of a permanent contract
  • Life insurance and private health insurance extensive to children for free and since first day of employment
  • Work life balance with part-time/full-time schedules available and 25 annual leave days
  • International career in a dynamic and enthusiastic environment
  • Training and internal career progression plan upon hiring
  • Several discounts available with our partners
  • Training and international career progression plan upon hiring

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.







🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Overview

At HubSpot, we aim to help businesses grow better every day. We are looking for highly skilled Data Analysts to join our team!

Job Summary

We have a number of Analyst positions open at various levels of seniority across a range of focus areas, including; EMEA Sales Strategy & Operations, Global / EMEA Sales & Marketing Planning, Global Insights & Analytics and Global Partner / Channel Strategy & Operations.

In these roles you will be combining deep data insights with business expertise to deliver comprehensive solutions that tackle critical challenges and enhance both operational efficiency and strategic outcomes. Some of our analyst roles are more specialised. Our recruitment team will help match your experience to these roles and determine the best fit.

About The Team

Revenue Operations partners with GTM leadership to drive daily business and achieve long-term strategic priorities. We use a data-driven approach to solve complex issues and drive business planning from strategy to execution.

Key Responsibilities


Be the go-to expert for the business, playing a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making
Participate in and develop the analyst community, fostering a high-performing, insights-driven culture
Be hands-on, delivering critical insights that shape strategic decisions and ensure data is at the core of our operations
Partner with leadership to drive business strategy, planning, goal-setting, and performance tracking
Scope and lead high-impact projects and execute on mission-critical strategic initiatives


These roles offer significant exposure to HubSpot C-suite and growth opportunities. If you thrive in a high-impact, strategic role and want to shape the future of the business, we’d love to hear from you.

Qualifications


A minimum number of years experience in a sales strategy role or equivalent level position:
Analyst - Min. 2 Years
Senior Analyst - 4+ Years
Demonstrated expertise in analytical or modeling techniques using tools like Looker, Hex, or Google Suite.
Strong aptitude for defining key metrics and conducting analyses to derive actionable insights.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with a proven track record of presenting to revenue-driven executives.
Strong capability to identify personal and professional growth opportunities and willingness to expand beyond baseline responsibilities.
Proficiency with MS Office Suite, Google Apps, Salesforce.com, and HubSpot CRM.
Proven SQL knowledge and experience.
Python or R is a plus.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, autonomous working environment.


We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.

If you need accommodations or assistance due to a disability, please reach out to us using this form. This information will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of determining an appropriate accommodation for the interview process.

At HubSpot, we value both flexibility and connection. Whether you’re a Remote employee, or work from the Office, we want you to start your journey here by building strong connections with your team and peers. If you are joining our Engineering team, you will be required to attend a regional HubSpot office for in-person onboarding. If you join our broader Product team, you’ll also attend other in-person events such as your Product Group Summit and other gatherings to continue building on those connections.

If you require an accommodation due to travel limitations or other reasons, please inform your recruiter during the hiring process. We are committed to supporting candidates who may need alternative arrangements

Germany Applicants: (m/f/d) - link to HubSpot's Career Diversity page here.

India Applicants: link to HubSpot India's equal opportunity policy here.

About HubSpot

HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers’ needs at any stage of growth. We’re also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.

You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #2 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2022 and has been recognized for its award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.

Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees across the globe work remotely and in HubSpot offices. Visit our careers website to learn more about the culture and opportunities at HubSpot.

By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot’s use of your personal information.

Title: Master Data Analyst
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!


Master Data Analyst


What you’ll have to do:


  • You will act as an expert user who can approve, validate, or reject data maintenance requests;
  • You will maintain/check/modify the master data for suppliers/clients;
  • Ensure compliance with processes/procedures for master data;
  • Provide a single point of contact for stakeholders and offer best practices;
  • Manage, improve, and provide visibility into the company's data performance.


What makes you a good fit:


  • Are passionate about Finance and you want to work in a dynamic environment;
  • Knowledge of the English language - intermediate level;
  • Excel knowledge - intermediate level;
  • Knowledge of the SAP platform is an advantage;
  • Knowledge of the master data module is an advantage;
  • Verbal and written communication skills;
  • Time management skills;
  • Analytical ability to solve problems and apply expert knowledge on master data processes and structures to find the most efficient solution;
  • Ability to understand an end-to-end process;
  • Strong attention to detail.


What we’ve prepared for you:


  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst to support financial and regulatory reporting. You will work with large datasets, optimize data processing, and ensure compliance with financial regulations. This role requires strong SQL skills to analyze and transform data, but it is not a hardcore programming position. You will collaborate with Business Analysts, Data Engineers, and Reporting Specialists to deliver accurate financial reports.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and process financial datasets for regulatory reporting.
Develop and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and structuring.
Ensure data quality, resolve discrepancies, and validate reporting outcomes.
Translate reporting requirements into structured data attributes.
Support compliance with IFRS, Basel III/IV, Solvency II, ECB/EBA regulations.




What We Are Looking For:

3+ years of experience in data, finance, or IT analysis.
Strong SQL skills (MS SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL).
Experience with data warehousing, ETL, and financial reporting tools.
Experience with Power BI is a plus.




What's in for you:

A challenging large-scale project.
International work environment and collaborative colleagues.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Manpower Croatia for Globalna hrana (McDonald's), a global leader in the quick-service restaurant industry, serving millions of customers every day, is looking for an ideal candidate to fill in the position of Data Analyst (m/f).




Place of work: Zagreb




Job description:




Customer & Market Insights:

Analyze customer data, organize and interpret market research to understand consumer behavior and preferences.
Identify trends in customer behavior, loyalty, and engagement to inform business strategies.
Conduct competitor analysis to benchmark McDonald's performance against industry trends.

Business Performance Analysis:

Assess restaurant and market performance by analyzing sales, traffic patterns, and operational metrics.
Support decision-making with data-driven recommendations for pricing, promotions, brand activations and menu development.
Develop and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure business success.

Data & Reporting:

Build reports and dashboards to track customer insights and business performance.
Work with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI) to present findings in a clear and actionable manner.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure insights are integrated into marketing and operational strategies.

Strategic Recommendations:

Provide recommendations to improve customer experience based on data insights.
Support digital and loyalty program initiatives with customer segmentation and personalization strategies.
Identify new opportunities for growth by leveraging data from various sources.




Requirements:




Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Data Analytics, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in similar working position.
Strong analytical skills with experience in Excel, and data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Ability to translate data into meaningful business insights and strategic recommendations.
Experience working with large datasets and market research methodologies.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Galway Hybrid

Duration: 12 Month Contract

Job Description: A Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics team is seeking a software engineer with experience in SQL, Tableau, Power BI, and BI Publisher. As a Software Engineer, your role is to create dashboards and reports to support business partners, as well as migrate reports from legacy platforms to new platforms as efficiently as possible.

Required Experience & Qualifications:

5+ years of industry experience as a software application engineer and developer
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, or equivalent technical field
Ability to work independently and build communication and rapport with partners and stakeholders
Expertise in writing SQL using Analytical and Aggregate functions in ANSI standards
Experience working with Oracle 12c and above
Knowledge of VBA macros and ability to decode and rewrite into SQL
Experience with BI tools such as Oracle Analytics Publisher, BI Publisher, Crystal Reports, or Power BI Report Builder for creating paginated reports
Experience with analytical BI tools like Tableau or Power BI
Knowledge of Autosys or any scheduling tool is preferred
Working experience with BI Publisher using Excel and Word templates is a significant advantage
Knowledge of Snowflake is a plus
Experience with performance tuning is a plus
Experience working in an Agile environment
Ability to take initiative, define a vision for product improvement, and execute with high quality
Ability to anticipate roadblocks, diagnose problems, and generate effective solutions

Skills & Abilities:

Strong data visualization skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to explain complex or technical information in a simple way to non-technical audiences
Strong prioritization skills within a dynamic and shifting environment
Ability to deliver solutions independently while working within a team of engineers
Strong client engagement skills with the ability to develop relationships and understand user needs
Effective collaboration with diverse individuals and groups in a constructive manner
Passion for automation, process improvement, and problem-solving
Creativity in determining optimal solutions for real-world problems
Willingness to challenge assumptions and explore alternative approaches
Enthusiasm for learning and delivering in a fast-paced environment

Key Responsibilities:

Understanding business users’ objectives and determining how best to deliver exceptional solutions
Recommending the right software tools and implementation strategies based on problem statements
Translating business requirements into technical requirements
Developing high-quality applications, user interfaces, and automation processes for business and technical users
Creating new applications, taking over ongoing projects, and supporting completed projects with maintenance and enhancements
Sharing knowledge and skills with peers to enhance the team’s overall impact

Impact of the Role: This role provides technology and support for portfolio management, research, trading, and investment operations. The team plays an integral role in delivering innovative, scalable, and industry-leading investment tools that enhance business capabilities globally.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for a Data Analyst!




Responsabilities:

You support to migrate current developed reports from Tableau On-premises to Tableau Cloud.
You collaborate with your data science team to smoothly switch reporting used data source from Microsoft SQL Server to Microsoft Azure.
You rebuild current developed reports with modern look and feel.
You reconfigure current developed reports if any business logics are changed while migration.
You develop new reports to support customers’ needs.
You work in a cross functional agile environment with an international team.
You stay updated on the latest advancements in data science, business intelligence, etc.




Requirements:

You have a Bachelor or Master degree in the field of Statistics, Business informatics, Econometrics or any related discipline.
You are fully skilled with Tableau, ideally certificated with “Tableau Certified Data Analyst” or higher.
You are experienced in Tableau environment and familiar with the DAX functions.
You bring work experience in any relevant field, ideally 5 years at least in similar analytical context with relevant quests for ITSM. (e.g. Incident Management, Problem Management, etc.) or CMDB (Configuration Management Database)
You are experienced in working in agile team and you can proactively explore and communicate findings.
You bring a strong expertise in cloud as well as on-premises storage systems. (preferably MS SQL Server and Azure services)
You have an analytical mindset with strong knowledge, and you are capable of communicating findings through the cross functional team.
You are fluent in English.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV in to vanessa.romao@decskill.com with reference “VR/DataAnalyst”.




Thank You!




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Global Data Governance Analyst
Description:
Company Description

The Data Strategy and Solution (DSS) team owns the research, creation, and maintenance of all 27,000+ distinct Label Insight attributes. This team is composed of industry experts including dietitians, food scientists, chemists, regulatory and product formulation experts. The Global Data Governance team within DSS is responsible for the quality and maintenance of our proprietary taxonomies: claims, certifications, ingredients, nutrients, and categories that are the foundation of all Label Insight data. The Global Data Governance Analyst is detail-oriented, able to make fast, but thoughtful decisions around NIQ and Label Insight data, regulations, and trends in the FMCG and grocery industries. You will receive on-the-job training for creating and managing Label Insight data taxonomies which will enable various LI-powered solutions within NIQ. Your willingness to use new NIQ platforms, learn new skills like data review, analysis, and coding will help build and maintain our data quality and, ultimately, enable customer health, trust, and new growth opportunities

Job Description


Manage the processing of globally sourced, English language data that powers attribution for various solutions. This includes on-package marketing text, ingredients, and nutrient data
Interpret, analyze, and clearly communicate our data and taxonomy structure
Audit, improve and develop internal database taxonomies
Expand our database to align with growing market trends and global expansion projects
Learn simple coding language to build and maintain LI attribute-powered solutions
Work with customer success teams to investigate and resolve customer inquirie


Qualifications


University degree, bachelor's degree or equivalent
Native speaker or high proficiency in the English language - both orally and in writing. Comfortable understand different accents
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint)
Comfortable learning new technology platforms (Coding, BI tools, GitHub, etc.)
Detail-oriented with the desire and ability to pick up new skills quickly
Comfortable with tedious and repetitive tasks
Self-motivated and able to manage deadlines and time on projects independently
Experience in data quality management, data review, or data cleaning is preferred
Technical mastery of:
BI and data querying tools and languages including: Looker, Power BI, Solr, SQL, and ElasticSearch
Internal NIQ tools and databases including: Label Insight NPE, Label Insight Explore 4.0, BB Product Library, and NIQ Discover
Internal Label Insight data management portals including: Digi, Taxonomy Management & Creation Portals, AMP, and others


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¡En K-LAGAN te estamos esperando para continuar creciendo juntos!




Somos una empresa estratégica internacional de servicios tecnológicos, comprometida esencialmente con su equipo y con la sociedad. Ofrecemos soluciones en servicios IT, desarrollos de ingeniería, de electrónica, y proyectos de I+D. Nuestro compromiso es contratar a los mejores talentos independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades, promoviendo su desarrollo profesional y personal.




Sobre el Rol




Buscamos un Senior Data Analyst con una sólida experiencia en visualización, modelado y análisis de datos para unirse a nuestro equipo. La persona seleccionada será responsable del desarrollo y mantenimiento de dashboards y reportes, transformando datos en información estratégica para la toma de decisiones empresariales.




Responsabilidades Clave




Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards en Power BI con un enfoque en usabilidad y rendimiento.
Implementar modelado de datos y cálculos DAX para garantizar análisis precisos y valiosos.
Utilizar SQL y Python para extraer, limpiar y transformar datos.
Colaborar con equipos multifuncionales para comprender necesidades del negocio y traducirlas en soluciones basadas en datos.
Trabajar con Azure DevOps, Databricks y PySpark para gestionar y procesar grandes volúmenes de datos.
Garantizar la calidad, integridad y consistencia de los datos en todos los informes.




Habilidades y Experiencia Requeridas

Más de 7 años de experiencia como Data Analyst.
Dominio de Power BI, DAX, SQL y Python.
Experiencia con Azure DevOps, Databricks y PySpark.
Mentalidad analítica y habilidades de resolución de problemas.
Capacidad para trabajar en un entorno ágil y colaborar con diferentes equipos.
Inglés fluido y excelentes habilidades de comunicación.




Habilidades Valoradas (Deseables)

Experiencia con Tableau y Qlik View.
Conocimientos en técnicas avanzadas de visualización de datos.




Entregables

Desarrollo y mantenimiento de dashboards interactivos y reportes.
Mejora continua de procesos y metodologías de análisis de datos.







🏢 Modalidad: Híbrido Barcelona (2 veces a la semana en oficina, 3 home office).




Además, en K-LAGAN queremos que disfrutes de la experiencia completa de ser parte de nuestro equipo, por ello ofrecemos:




✅ IMPRESCINDIBLE: Contrato indefinido y proyecto estable.




🎉 Team building: Barbacoas, cafés tecnológicos, y más ideas para estar más cerca de vosotros.




📈 Seguimiento continuo: Contarás con nuestros fantásticos TBM para crecer y recibir feedback.




🎓 Departamento de carreras y formación: ¿Quieres dar el siguiente paso? ¡Te ayudamos!




🎊 Eventos especiales: Cena de verano, Cena de Navidad y Día Solidario.




🎂 Día de cumpleaños libre: ¡Disfrútalo como, dónde y con quién quieras!




👶 Ayudas en guarderías, KM e idiomas.

Title: Data Analyst con Power BI
Description:
¡Ampliamos nuestro equipo! 🔎




¿Buscas un nuevo reto donde desarrollar tu carrera y aprender nuevas tecnologías? Entonces sigue leyendo porque esto te puede interesar.




Scalian es una empresa de más de 6.000 personas con una dimensión internacional, con oficinas en Europa y América del Norte. Estamos especializados en dar servicios a diferentes clientes enfocados en Data, Cloud e Inteligencia Artificial.




¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con Power BI para integrarse en nuestro equipo de profesionales de Scalian. Dentro de este rol estarás desarrollando las siguientes funciones:

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards interactivos en Power BI que proporcionen insights clave para diferentes áreas de la empresa.
Crear y mantener medidas y cálculos complejos utilizando DAX para proporcionar análisis avanzados y personalizados.
Colaborar estrechamente con el Data Engineering Lead y su equipo para garantizar que los modelos de datos sean óptimos para el reporting.
Aplicar las mejores prácticas de diseño de visualizaciones para asegurar claridad, accesibilidad y usabilidad.
Asegurar que los informes y dashboards estén actualizados y reflejen los datos más recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.




Requisitos mínimos:

Sólidos conocimientos puestos en práctica con Power BI.
Experiencia y conocimiento de DAX.
Fluidez escrita y hablada en inglés.
Valorable tener certificaciones de Power BI.




¿Qué tendrás con nosotros?

🚀 Formar parte de un equipo de alto nivel bajo tecnologías punteras en el mercado.

💻 Modalidad 100% teletrabajo

⛱ 25 días laborables de vacaciones

📝 Contrato indefinido

📚 Formación continua, certificaciones, meetups y planes de desarrollo profesional personalizados para que podamos seguir creciendo juntos. Contamos con acceso a plataformas internas con contenido abierto para que lo disfrutes cuando tú quieras y a tu ritmo.

🕐 Jornada completa con horario flexible para facilitar la conciliación entre vida familiar y profesional.

🎉 After works en las oficinas

🎂 La tarde del cumpleaños libre

🏋️‍♀️ Descuentos en gimnasios

💲Programas de retribución flexible: seguro médico, tarjeta restaurante, abono de transporte, cheques para escuelas infantiles.

🌏 Como parte del grupo Scalian, abrimos nuestras fronteras y crecemos internacionalmente.

♻️ En el grupo apostamos por iniciativas sostenibles.




¡Despega en tu carrera con Scalian Spain!✈

Title: Data Analyst HR Junior
Description:
Max Mara Fashion Group
An Italian House of Brands, Family Owned Since 1951.



Passion, commitment and tradition have created a unique fashion style: today 10 Main Brands and more than 60 different Collections find common ground in quality, style and respect for the distinctive feature that make Max Mara Fashion Group one of the most famous worldwide.



Max Mara Fashion Group, with more than 40 companies and over 5,500 employees, operates in 105 countries.
Our ecosystem is made of more than 50 Departments, including Fashion Design, Marketing, Operations, Retail, Stores, ICT, Architecture Design, Economics, BI, etc. in an Holistic approach to our Customers and leveraging all the new digital competences.





Job Description



The HRIS analyst collects, organizes, analyzes, and interprets data contained within the company’s HRIS (HCM Systems, HR Databases and more). He/She studies the data, and creates reports summarizing important findings. He/She works closely with other teams and stakeholders to identify data points that would be significant, and then perform data analysis to gather that information.
The HRIS analyst should be comfortable using programming languages, proficient with data analytics, and should have experience using tools for data visualization like Tableau,Power BI, etc. Familiarity with HR software programs is helpful. Strong organizational skills are required.
Reports to the HR Digital Manager/Coordinator





Qualifications







Manages the Information Design tools connected to Data Visualization (dynamic and interactive representation through BI dashboards)
Develops new knowledge from the analysis of the data it uses to inspire decisions and drive business
Create and manage standard dashboards and other information delivery services for internal customers.
Maintain and develop enterprise-wide metrics for strategic reporting and analysis.
Presents data and analyzes effectively to internal stakeholders
Uses statistical techniques to produce solutions to emerging problems
Develop customized reports to meet user needs.
Capitalizes on the use of insights, findings, datasets and statistical models for various business needs
Keeps updated on new tools and techniques of data analysis
Perform regular HRIS data audits to ensure system accuracy.
Team with IT to manage system feeds to vendors and other related systems.
Promotes the development of training/learning of the Role through self, digital and collaborative learning activities aimed at innovation and improving the effectiveness and efficiency of one's Responsibilities
Promotes, adopts and develops the use of technologies digital within its function in relation to both the management of the process and in relations with internal and external interlocutors involved in the business
Adopts significant behaviors and promotes actions linked to Sustainable Development, understood as the interconnection of practices oriented towards Environmental Care of Business Processes and Organizational Community
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SEARGIN IS HIRING!

As a dynamic multinational tech company operating in 50 countries, we drive innovation and create projects that shape the future and greatly enhance the quality of life. You will find our solutions in the space industry, supporting scientists in the development of cancer drugs, and implementing innovative technological solutions for industrial clients worldwide. These are just some of the areas in which we operate!




Currently, for the new Seargin project, we are looking for a Data Analyst.




Cooperation: B2B

Location: Remote work from Poland




The Domain Delivery Transformation program aims to unify and optimize this ecosystem of three product lines for a more streamlined and cohesive structure. The program will enable simplified and consistent end-to-end delivery and support processes in order to increase future agility and achieve cost efficiencies and a consistent employee experience.

This is achieved by consolidating a significant range of current fragmented managed services contracts, harmonizing and simplifying underpinning support processes and by leveraging a clear sourcing strategy for all contributing roles to the product enabling services within the SS&WE domain.




Role Overview:

Support data-driven decision-making by providing accurate forecasts and strategic recommendations for process improvement and automation.
Drive self-service reporting initiative using ThoughtSpot




Responsibilities for the position:

Generate data insights using trends and storytelling techniques to support decision-making
Identify areas for improvement by analyzing large volumes of data
Predictive analytics for budget forecasting and onsite support issues




Required technologies and skills:

Python
Tableau
ThoughtSpot
Snowflake
SQL
ML
Great storyteller




Other Needs for Resource Consideration:

Proactive and self-driven
Critical thinking




Discover the Power of IT Excellence. Apply!

To learn more about Seargin, please visit our web page: www.seargin.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A leading travel agency seeks a highly skilled Data Analyst to provide data-driven insights impacting business performance. This remote role requires expertise in SQL and data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, SSRS preferred) to analyze travel booking data, customer trends, and financial transactions.




Responsibilities:

Develop and optimize SQL queries for data extraction from various sources (e.g., Amadeus, Sabre, Galileo, Travelport).
Create and automate reports on sales, customer trends, agent performance, financials, and operational efficiency.
Build interactive dashboards using BI tools to visualize key performance indicators (KPIs).
Collaborate with finance and marketing teams to provide data-driven support and identify opportunities.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and consistency across platforms.
Implement automated processes to improve efficiency.




Requirements:

Proven experience as an SQL Report Developer or Data Analyst.
Strong SQL skills and experience with large datasets.
Proficiency in at least one BI tool.
Excellent analytical and communication skills.
Travel industry experience is highly desirable.
Experience with data warehousing/ETL, Python/R, and cloud platforms is a plus.

Show more

  • Develop and optimize SQL queries for data extraction from various sources (e.g., Amadeus, Sabre, Galileo, Travelport).
  • Create and automate reports on sales, customer trends, agent performance, financials, and operational efficiency.
  • Build interactive dashboards using BI tools to visualize key performance indicators (KPIs).
  • Collaborate with finance and marketing teams to provide data-driven support and identify opportunities.
  • Ensure data quality, integrity, and consistency across platforms.
  • Implement automated processes to improve efficiency.


Requirements:

  • Proven experience as an SQL Report Developer or Data Analyst.
  • Strong SQL skills and experience with large datasets.
  • Proficiency in at least one BI tool.
  • Excellent analytical and communication skills.
  • Travel industry experience is highly desirable.
  • Experience with data warehousing/ETL, Python/R, and cloud platforms is a plus.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Siamo un’azienda italiana al 100% e ci occupiamo d’informatica da oltre 50 anni. Lo facciamo grazie a più di 900 persone di cui 650 tecnici specializzati che operano ogni giorno dal nostro Campus Tecnologico di Brunello (VA). Sviluppiamo nuove soluzioni in diversi settori e offriamo servizi dedicati all'infrastruttura e agli utenti: Hybrid Cloud, Workplace e Cyber Security. All'interno del nostro Campus non ci dedichiamo solamente all'Information Technology, ma anche alle Energie Rinnovabili, ai Gestionali Aziendali e ai Dispositivi Ricondizionati.

Posizione:

Ricerchiamo Un* Data Analyst da inserire nel team di Business Intelligence all’interno dei Sistemi Informativi Elmec.

La risorsa, riportando all’IT Manager, si dovrà occupare di:


Elaborazione report e analisi dati per Utenti Business
Progettazione dashboard
Sviluppo data warehouse
Definizione delle strategie di miglioramento dei processi aziendali
Relazione con i richiedenti delle diverse Business Unit aziendali


Requisiti:


Almeno 2 anni di esperienza maturata nel ruolo
Buona conoscenza di SQL per lo sviluppo del Data warehouse, mediante procedure ETL
Buona padronanza di almeno uno dei seguenti strumenti di analisi dati: Qlik Sense, Reporting services, Tableau, Power BI, (SAS)
Conoscenza della lingua inglese pari o superiore al livello B2


Costituirà titolo preferenziale aver conseguito una laurea in uno dei seguenti corsi di studio: matematica, statistica o ingegneria gestionale.

Altre informazioni:

I valori aziendali che guidano il nostro lavoro quotidiano sono:


Cura del contesto lavorativo
Senso di responsabilità
Formazione continua, orientata allo sviluppo del potenziale
Fiducia e affidabilità


Offriamo


Inquadramento e retribuzione commisurati all’esperienza maturata nel ruolo
Modalità di lavoro ibrido


Welfare aziendale


Bistrot aziendale
Palestra aziendale, campi da calcetto, basket, tennis e sala yoga
Mercatino del riuso, casetta dell'acqua e distributore di detersivi ecologici: le nostre iniziative per essere sostenibili
Sportello di supporto psicologico e visite mediche di prevenzione
Consegna in azienda di spesa e degli acquisti personali online
Gruppo di acquisto di prodotti sostenibili e a Km 0


Nel rispetto delle pari opportunità, prendiamo in considerazione le domande di tutti i candidati qualificati indipendentemente dalla loro nazionalità, genere, età, cultura, religione o orientamento sessuale.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Freelance Performance Data Analyst

Location: Brussels (50% on-site, 50% remote)

Duration: End of 2025

Start: ASAP

Languages: English + French OR Dutch




Role Overview:

Join the Measurement & Performance team within Marketing & Communication to analyze and visualize campaign performance, optimize strategies, and drive data-driven decision-making. You will work closely with the Campaign Manager, Product Owners, and Cluster Leads in this new department, requiring strong communication skills to translate data insights into actionable strategies.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop dashboards and reports to track marketing performance, campaign effectiveness, and customer behavior.
Analyze KPIs and campaign data to provide insights and recommend optimizations.
Ensure accurate data monitoring, integration, and visualization for data-driven decision-making.
Collaborate with stakeholders to refine campaign strategies and business objectives.
Train users on reporting tools and foster a data-driven culture within the team.




Required Skills & Experience:

5+ years in data analysis, reporting, and visualization, with a focus on marketing, campaign performance, or business intelligence.
Strong proficiency in SQL, Tableau, and KPI tracking.
Experience in Marketing, Campaign, or Performance Analysis.
Excellent communication skills to work closely with the Campaign Manager, Product Owners, and Cluster Leads.
Experience in reporting and dashboard development.
Ideally experienced in SAS, Adobe Analytics, and Adobe Campaign.
Analytical mindset, ability to work under pressure, and strong business acumen.

Title: Data analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data analyst

Seniority: Junior (1-3 years)

Type of position: Hybrid model in Oporto. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:


3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of SQL for querying, data extraction, and manipulation.
Familiarity with ETL processes (experience with Stambia is a plus).
Ability to work with large datasets and optimize data workflows.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Fluent in French and English (both written and spoken).
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Proficiency in Power BI or other data visualization tools.
Knowledge of data governance and data management best practices.
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Sustainability Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a specialist real estate consulting firm, is taking an innovative and disruptive approach to structuring property development deals. They are seeking a Sustainability Data Analyst to support data administrative tasks for a large, complex project with a US-based client.




Responsibilities:

Identify and autonomously reach out to global stakeholders to gather essential sustainability data.
Perform thematic analysis of findings, drawing actionable insights before aggregating data.
Assist in the creation and management of an initiative tracking tool for business use.
Handle data-heavy administrative tasks to ensure smooth project operations.




Requirements:

1-2 years of experience in data analysis.
Bachelor's degree in quantitative field
Proven experience with data-heavy administrative tasks.
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights.
Proactive, go-getter, with interest in sustainability




Details:

Start date: ASAP
Location: US-based (remote possible, close to EDT or PDT time zones)
Salary: $50,000 pro-rated Fixed Term Contract ($25,000 for 6 months).
Duration: 6 months
